job_title: AWS Managed Services (AMS) Business Development Lead, ASEAN
job_description:
Job Description :
Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the pioneer and recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide a platform for IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 2000 companies in financial services, pharmaceuticals, and technology. Whether customers are new to AWS, or already operating at scale, AWS Managed Services (AMS) is focused on helping customers accelerate and scale their value realization through the provision of best practice cloud operations capabilities that reduce complexities and cost, and transforms their operational and financial business models.

AWS is seeking a Senior Business Development Manager (BDM) team in ASEAN. The role will be responsible for working with both in-country AWS sales & cross functional teams, to (i) define and deliver internal AMS enablement & sales collateral (ii) drive continued growth of the AMS partner network (iii) implement effective and targeted customer acquisition programs (iv) win new AMS customer and assist with the growth of existing AMS customers. Collaboration with local and regional cross functional teams such as AWS partner team, professional services, and sales will be essential to success. In addition, this role will support ongoing internal product and process improvement, manage all associated regional reporting requirements, support key customer and partner engagements, and act as the regional point of contact for internal and external escalations.

The ideal candidate will possess a business and IT background that enables them to drive an engagement and interact at the highest levels of large Enterprises and Enterprise partners. The candidate will have the technical depth and business experience to easily communicate the benefits of cloud computing and managed cloud services to IT architects, engineering teams, and C-Level executives. The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and long-term about the needs of complex global businesses and the business process changes required to adopt cloud technology at scale. The ideal candidate will be a strong sales hunter with will be familiar with complex legacy IT environments, managed enterprise IT infrastructure services, Enterprise applications, ITIL, and has done market analysis, deal negotiation and construction, and has a background that enables them to create scalable programs that apply holistic approaches to selling to Enterprises and Enterprise Partners.

Key job responsibilities
. Work with the AWS sales leads & teams to define, build and deploy targeted sales campaigns around the AMS offering
. Support existing AMS partners, and lead the recruitment and activation of new AMS partners
. Support all aspects of the customer engagement and AMS sales cycle, meeting with senior level (CxO) customer contacts to discuss their business issues and explore how AMS can address and resolve these issues.
. Serve as an evangelist for the new service within AWS, and externally
. Establish metrics to measure and track related to adoption of the service, and field seller awareness with a continual focus on improving the approach based on those measurements.
. Prepare and give business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and metrics
Basic Qualifications :
. Business or technology degree / qualifications
. 10+ years of sales / program / product management experience
. Demonstrated strong communications skills, as well as leadership skills
. Experience selling cloud services and platforms (IaaS / PaaS / SaaS)

Preferred Qualifications :
. Experience in selling technical cloud services or software technology products
. Experience in selling outsourcing and or managed services
. Experience working with CXO and selling large strategic projects
. Previous experience working for a global technology company

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow.

You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship.

You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today.

If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY

At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Job Description :
Cloud Computing is revolutionizing Information Technology. Since early 2006, Amazon Web Services (AWS) has provided companies of all s with an infrastructure web services platform in the cloud. With AWS customers can requisition compute power, storage, and other services-gaining access to a suite of elastic IT infrastructure services as their business demands them. Customers pay only for what they use, with no up-front expenses or long-term commitments, making AWS the most cost-effective, flexible way to deliver their applications to their customers and clients.

Since 2006 AWS is the leader in the global IaaS cloud computing space and is continually growing. Would you like to be a central part of a Talent Acquisition team that is responsible for fuelling the rapid growth of AWS globally Are you a builder Do you thrive in high growth ambiguous environments Are you a process oriented data driven techncial recruiter / talent partner who loves to dive deep to fix complex operational challenges allowing for greater scalability and global impact

The Amazon Web Services (AWS) Recruiting team is seeking a talented, customer-focused Techncial Talent Specialsit to identify and assess top technical talent for AWS Professional Services / Technology Consulting teams across APJ but with a specific focus on the Japanese market. As a Talent Acquisition Specialist will partner closely with their hiring managers to provide guidance on addressable talent pools and market conditions, create customized sourcing strategies, build pipelines, and source top candidates for complex customer facing technical roles. The candidate must be able to successfully manage, prioritize and close searches against a timeline and have experience setting benchmarks, metrics, and understand how to prioritize to hit all customer SLAs. They thrive in an innovative, fast-paced environment, can roll up their sleeves, work hard, have fun, and get the job done. They will draw on extensive knowledge of Talent Acquisition and functional areas of the business, forging dynamic relationships with business leaders, hiring managers and HR business partners. They have a reputation for being exceptional at candidate generation, client/account management, organization, possess strong verbal and written communication skills, have an ability to prioritize their time, demonstrate pushback and a sense of urgency, and understand the value of providing amazing customer service.

Core Responsibilities: -
. Partner with hiring teams to build effective sourcing, assessment, and closing approaches with an ability to manage customer/partner expectations through a deep understanding of the market.
. Must be able to understand how to recruit passive candidates and possess the mentality to profile people and gauge chemistry of candidates for fit and understand their motivation rather than sell a role.
. Build and maintain network of potential candidates through pro-active market research and on-going relationship management conducts in-depth interviews of potential candidates, demonstrating ability to anticipate hiring manager preferences through high offer-to-interview ratios.
. Drive simplification and contribute to increase productivity across the team
. Agility to adapt the portfolio according to the capacity planning to ensure the team is adequately staffed to prevent drops in productivity or support
. Support and drive the roadmap for the AWS APJC Talent Acquisition team and partner with teams outside of the APJC region to make sure we are aligned in supporting the global AWS businesses
. Recommend ideas and strategies related to recruitment that will contribute to the long-range growth of the company, implementing any new processes and fine tuning standard processes for recruiting that fits within AWS/Amazon's mission to deliver the highest quality results to the customer.
. Participate in special projects/recruiting initiatives, including assessment of best practices in interviewing techniques, leveraging of internal sources of talent and identification of top performers for senior-level openings.

Basic Qualifications :
. 5+ years of corporate/in-house and or search firm recruiting experience including sourcing and full life cycle recruiting with a focus on technnical roles.
. Native or Business fluent Japanese & English (both written & spoken) language skills.
. Experience building and utilizing a variety of sourcing plans and tools, including proactive phone and internet research.
. CTS/ATS experience with sourcing, tracking and managing candidates - MS Office - including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.
. Experience managing and prioritizing multiple searches, projects and client relationships.
. Self-sufficient and able to work with little direct supervision.
. Strong consulting skills and demonstrated ability to work in a team environment, as a team leader and member.
Preferred Qualifications :
. Strong client focus and commitment to continuous improvement ability to proactively network and establish effective working relationships, must pursue conscious cost-containment efforts in recruiting, continually seek new sourcing options, and develop creative approaches to delivering candidates to the customers.
. Possess strong analytic skills with ability to create, measure, and scale the right workflow between candidates, hiring managers, and the recruiting team.
. Leadership experience managing recruiters and coordinators.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

job_description:
The Solution Architect (SA) role is a KEY pre-sales technical position in Alibaba Cloud's international business division. Our seasoned solution architects offer comprehensive IT knowledge and industry insights when crafting solutions for customers and partners. Solution Architects are ultimately responsible for architecting solutions that enable customer and partner success.
Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Working closely with customers and partners to ensure successful solution delivery of Alibaba Cloud services.
As a thought leader, evangelizing and helping customers and partners understand the technical and business benefits of Alibaba Cloud products, solutions and services.
Understanding the unique requirements of customers and partners, and providing appropriate technical solutions and architecture designs based on Alibaba Cloud technologies, solutions and services.
Creating and presenting solution architecture designs to C-level/Senior personnel.
Responsible for demo development and testing Alibaba Cloud services when necessary.
Providing assistance to customers and partners to migrate their existing IT systems onto Alibaba Cloud
Providing guidance in large enterprise implementation.
Job Requirements:
Solid foundation in computer science and cloud computing, with a good understanding of network, compute, storage systems
Solid experience with modern web stacks, big data or AI applications
A minimum of 8+ years in solution architecture design or consulting with hands on large-scale implementation experiences
Expert knowledge and understanding of solution architecture design, and familiar with architectural methodologies and practices in Internet based applications
Familiarity with procedures and tools for application migration and cloud/virtualization solutions for Enterprise customers
Ability to learn quickly and have a passion for cloud technology
Ability to think strategically about business, products, and technical challenges
Possess a passion for innovation, and helping customers and partners to achieve success
Industry and domain expertise in some key areas such as: Supply Chain Management, Manufactory, automotive and E-Commerce are essential; Genomic/Healthcare, Media, Travel, Education, CDN is a plus
Experience in traditional enterprise IT and LOB system is a plus;EA and SA certification are a plus;Security, Big data, ML, AI experience is a plus
Comfortable working for a global start-up, with high cultural diversity;Ability to work in a fast-paced, high pressure, deadline-driven environment
Excellent presentation, public speaking, and written communication skills

tech_stack: ['Doctorate ']
job_description:
Job Description

You will be part of the clinical microbiology lab in SGH which plays a key role in the laboratory diagnosis of infectious diseases.
You will be leading a section which focuses on bacterial genomics. The results will contribute to the understanding of disease processes, infection prevention and control, and public health.
You will mentor and coach junior staff. You will also assist in establishing, implementing and updating departmental policies and procedures.

Job Requirements
PhD in a relevant discipline (biomedical science, bioinformatics, computational biology, data science or related field).
Masters in a relevant discipline with a minimum of 1 year of relevant work experience
Degree in Biomedical Science, Biological Science, Medical Technology or equivalent with minimum of 3 years of relevant work experience
Good command of English, communications and interpersonal skills are important
Proficiency in scripting and statistical language (eg Perl, Python, R, particularly in the use of packages such as biopython).
Prior experience in wet lab and bioinformatics analysis of human/microbial genomes, metagenomics will be an advantage.
Knowledge in high performance computing (HPC) and cloud computing.

DESCRIPTION

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the pioneer and recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide a platform for IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to Global 2000 companies in financial services, pharmaceuticals, industrial equipment, automotive, aerospace, and others sectors. The rapid pace of innovation is driven by more and better access to computing resources, allowing unprecedented amounts of data to be analyzed in near real time on nearly infinite computational resources. Will the cure for cancer come out of a lab or out of a remote computing cluster Emerging technology like AI/ML, IoT, quantum computing, and autonomous systems are making new discoveries possible every day. Our job is to facilitate and support the innovators making those discoveries.

We are looking for a Senior Specialist, Autonomous Computing to join the Autonomous Computing (AC) go to market team. The AC team enables the at-scale development of autonomous systems that seek to improve productivity, safety, and customer operations in some of the most challenging use-cases. Examples of autonomous systems include mobility (autonomous vehicles, aerial taxis), smart electricity grids (demand response), robotics (situational awareness), supply chain (intelligent inventory management), and Industrial Internet (continuously learning digital twins of industrial equipment), and healthcare (diagnostic imaging, precision medicine, drug discovery).

In this role, you will work closely with customers to understand the requirements and complexities involved in developing their autonomous systems, with a particular emphasis on the use of simulations, machine learning, and/or accelerated computing (GPUs, FPGAs, custom ASICs) technologies. You will help define the next AC workloads to pursue, define go-to-market strategies and lead cross-functional initiatives to expand existing markets, develop adoption programs and identify new opportunities. These activities include sizing the market opportunity, identifying a pipeline of potential customers, working with customers to understand technical requirements for proof-of-concepts, creating content to train the field teams, leading external workshops to drive industry thought-leadership, working with product teams to define new features, and identifying partners or potential acquisitions.

The ideal candidate will have deep-domain expertise in one or more domains such as aviation, automotive, power & utilities, renewable energy, financial services, health care, life sciences, or other industry which benefits from autonomous systems. You have business experience to drive an engagement at the CxO/VP level, and have demonstrated program/product go-to-market expertise that will help you work with customers to identify use-cases that take advantage of the power of AWS storage, compute, networking, big data, machine learning, and IoT technologies. Additionally, the candidate will have demonstrated some level of hands-on experience either developing autonomous systems, creating and running simulations (such as, but not limited to, scientific simulations, CFD, FEA, process simulation, discrete event simulation), developing large-scale ML models, accelerating computing workloads on GPUs (or ASICs), and/or developing accelerators. The candidate has the technical depth to communicate the benefits of simulations to IT architects, engineering teams, and C-Level executives, while working backwards from customer requirements to suggest scalable solutions and architectures. The candidate should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions, and work cross-organizationally to build consensus. A keen sense of ownership, drive, and being scrappy is a must.

Roles & Responsibilities
. Serve as a key team member of the Autonomous Computing team to identify, define and prioritize the AWS market segments, customer base, and industry verticals we target to achieve the most impactful outcomes
. Develop strategic go-to-market plans for target markets and ensure it is in line with the AWS strategic direction
. Execute the strategic go-to-market plans while working with key internal stakeholders (e. g. solutions architects, product service teams, sales teams, legal, support, etc.)
. Identify specific prospects/partners to approach while communicating the specific value proposition for their business and use case
. Engage with prospects, partners, cross functional teams, and key customers
. Work with customers to understand their Autonomous Systems workflows and how AWS technologies can enable their use-case
. Identify and promote repeatable use cases and case studies to build AWS internal and external market awareness
. Collaborate with internal teams to understand the technical requirements of our customers and work closely with the internal development teams to guide the direction of our product offerings
. Develop long-term strategic partnerships in support of our key markets
. Handle high volume of engagements and the fast pace of the cloud computing market

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. 5+ years of business development, management consulting, strategic partnerships, enterprise sales, technology development, or program/product management experience
. 2+ years working experience developing and deploying simulations (such as, but not limited to, scientific simulations, CFD, FEA, process simulation, discrete event simulation), developing large-scale ML models, and/or developing accelerators
. Experience building Go-To-Market (GTM) plans that scale across an organization
. Deep knowledge of one or more industries that represent potential autonomous computing use-cases
. Experience interfacing with customers (Enterprise, SMB, and Startups) and solution building ability
. Strong analytical skills, and demonstrated ability to turn detailed data analysis into useful strategic insight that drives customer adoption and recommendations to the business
. Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must. Experience speaking at technology conferences, as well as communicating across the organization from technical staff to VP/CxOs.
. Demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations is key in a matrix environment
. Business and/or technical degree required

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. M.S., PhD, MBA or other higher degree in a business or technical field
. Solid negotiation skills, and business and financial acumen
. Meticulous attention to detail ability to juggle many tasks in parallel without lowering your quality bar
. Ability to succeed in a fast-paced, innovative, and rapidly evolving industry and business organization
. Strong analytical skills, and demonstrated ability to turn detailed data analysis into useful strategic insight in order to drive customer adoption and make appropriate recommendations to the business

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today.

If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY

At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Job Description :
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the pioneer and recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide a platform for IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to Global 2000 companies in financial services, pharmaceuticals, industrial equipment, automotive, aerospace, and others sectors. The rapid pace of innovation is driven by more and better access to computing resources, allowing unprecedented amounts of data to be analyzed in near real time on nearly infinite computational resources. Will the cure for cancer come out of a lab or out of a remote computing cluster Emerging technology like AI/ML, IoT, quantum computing, and autonomous systems are making new discoveries possible every day. Our job is to facilitate and support the innovators making those discoveries.

We are looking for a Senior Specialist, Autonomous Computing to join the Autonomous Computing (AC) go to market team. The AC team enables the at-scale development of autonomous systems that seek to improve productivity, safety, and customer operations in some of the most challenging use-cases. Examples of autonomous systems include mobility (autonomous vehicles, aerial taxis), smart electricity grids (demand response), robotics (situational awareness), supply chain (intelligent inventory management), and Industrial Internet (continuously learning digital twins of industrial equipment), and healthcare (diagnostic imaging, precision medicine, drug discovery).

In this role, you will work closely with customers to understand the requirements and complexities involved in developing their autonomous systems, with a particular emphasis on the use of simulations, machine learning, and/or accelerated computing (GPUs, FPGAs, custom ASICs) technologies. The candidate has the technical depth to communicate the benefits of simulations to IT architects, engineering teams, and C-Level executives, while working backwards from customer requirements to suggest scalable solutions and architectures. The candidate should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions, and work cross-organizationally to build consensus. A keen sense of ownership, drive, and being scrappy is a must.

job_title: Head of Data Analytics Solutions Architect, APJ
job_description:
Job Description :
Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is proud to be the pioneer and widely recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 500 companies in industries such as financial services, pharmaceuticals, and high technology.

AWS is looking for an experienced and motivated technical leader to build and manage a team of technically skilled, customer facing Solutions Architects focusing on Analytics in APJ. You will help develop the industry's best cloud based solutions architects by enabling and coaching them on best practices, specialized solution selling, presentation and speaking skills, as well as how to create and present architectures of widely varying and complexity for our specialized services. Working closely with our engineering teams, you will help enable new capabilities for our customers to develop and deploy workloads on AWS.
In this role, you will need to be technically capable and credible in your own right as well as effective in shaping the customer and solutions focused skills of your team. You must enjoy learning and introducing new technologies in order to help colleagues and customers embrace and adopt new solutions. Furthermore, thought leadership in terms of looking beyond the technology and considering the value technology creates for our customers, and helping to change how technology is viewed are important aspects of the role. You will need to be adept at interacting, communicating and partnering with other Specialized Organization teams within AWS such as services teams, field solutions architecture, sales, marketing, partner organizations, business development, and professional services, as well as representing your team to executive management. You should be passionate about helping companies/partners understand best practices for operating on AWS.

Here are some other qualities we are looking for:
. Enjoy developing technical talent to achieve great things. You will have a passion for educating, training, and enabling cloud solutions experts for a diverse and challenging set of customers
. Have a strong understanding of emerging technology solutions. The ideal candidate will have past experience working as a Solutions Architect or similar role and managing a team of Solutions Architects and Solution Architect Managers. You will enjoy keeping your existing technical skills honed and developing new ones, so you can make strong contributions to deep architecture discussions.

Roles and Responsibilities:
. In partnership with the specialized sales teams, formulate and execute a sales strategy to exceed revenue objectives
. Hire, on-board, train, and develop new Solutions Architects and Managers
. Coach Solutions Architects in the skills needed to conduct one-to-few and one-to-many training sessions so they can transfer deep technical skills to customers who are considering or using AWS
. Step into a Solutions Architect role when required to support our customer base
. Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the AWS solutions architect community
. Guide and motivate the development of whitepapers, data sheets, and other high-value customer facing guidance and best practices

Basic Qualifications :
. Bachelor's degree
. Leadership experience in a technical, customer-facing role in the technology industry

Preferred Qualifications :
. 10+ years of technical design/implementation /consulting experience in the technology industry
. MBA/Technical Master's Degree
. Commitment to promoting a diverse and inclusive culture where all Amazonians and customers are able to participate fully, and enjoy respect and dignity
. Exceptional people-management skills able to inspire and foster the right behaviors in others through leading by example (Player/Coach)
. Experience working with new product/service development teams
. Experience leading leaders
. Professional experience architecting/operating solutions built on AWS
. Achieved Associate and/or Professional AWS certifications
. Working knowledge of software development tools and methodologies
. Experience deploying large-scale production quality systems
. Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT Management, developers, and at large events
. Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly
. Experience migrating or transforming legacy customer solutions to the cloud
. Track record of building rapport with senior customer executives (e.g. CEO, CIO, CTO)
. Motivated self-starter, proactive and action-oriented
. Strategic problem solving and collaboration skills
. Strong verbal and written communications skills in English
. Proven ability to deliver results in a matrix organization (leveraging multiple functions and teams)
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Amazon Web Services, Inc. (AWS) enables customers of all s to run their applications on Amazon's industry-leading cloud computing infrastructure. AWS is growing very rapidly with hundreds of thousands of companies in over 190 countries on the platform. This growth is driving the need for an experienced Business Insights Analyst. Amazon has a strong culture of data-driven decision-making requiring timely, accurate, and actionable intelligence that delivers significant business value. We are looking for a hands-on and motivated self-starter who is passionate about using data to help us measure every area of the business and influence decision-making.

In this role, the Business Insights Analyst serves as the subject matter expert to fulfil data-driven decision making demands. As the successful candidate, you must be able to roll-up your sleeves and work directly with large and complex datasets. You will continuously evolve business reporting, conduct data analysis, build self-service reporting and analytical tools, and deliver business insights in an environment of rapid growth and increasing complexity.

You will be passionate about your work, detail-oriented, analytical, and possess creative problem-solving abilities. You will need to demonstrate subject matter expertise in querying and extracting large datasets and the accompanying tools and programming languages needed to work with them. You will possess good communication and project management skills, is customer obsessed and able to communicate complex business insights both verbally and in writing in a clear and precise manner.

Main responsibilities as follows.

1) Lead the development of self-service reporting and analysis by creating and owning business reports and insight products
2) Conduct data analysis to solve business problems through the use of statistical and/or machine learning models
3) Continuously sharpen the skillset by learning and maintaining knowledge of existing and emerging reporting/analytical tools
4) Collaborate with the internal and global data engineering teams on the design, development and maintenance of data infrastructure including data models
5) Collaborate with the internal and worldwide data science teams on the design, development and maintenance of statistical and/or artificial intelligence/machine learning (AI/ML) models

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

1) Bachelor's degree with emphasis on statistical and analytical skills
2) Proficiency in relational databases (Redshift, RDS, SQL Server, MySQL, etc.) and SQL for querying and extracting data
3) Proficiency in at least programming languages (Python, Java, R, etc.) for data gathering, data cleansing and statistical analysis
4) Expertise in data visualisation software (QuickSight, Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView, etc.) for effective data presentation
5) Creative and analytical thinking to generate interesting approaches to answering business questions
6) Effectively use data to make strategic business decisions and generate next best actions
7) Strong and effective written and oral communication to clearly convey data findings
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

1) 5+ years of work experience as a Business Analyst
2) Experience working in the Information Technology industry is highly beneficial
3) Proficiency in different types of databases (relational vs. non-relational, etc.) and their relevant use cases
4) Experience working with Cloud Computing
5) Experience in agile product management
6) Experience in deploying artificial intelligence/machine learning (AI/ML) models into production
7) AWS certified (AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate, AWS Certified Data Analytics, etc.)

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

We are looking for a driven and experienced individual for a client, a renowned unicorn company. This role is a Permanent opportunity. SENIOR / EXECUTIVE ENGINEER (SYSTEM ANALYST/ DESIGNER)
What you will be working on

Produce and maintain application interfaces and system design specifications for development teams to elaborate and ensure smooth and secure end-to-end integration of the different systems, particularly front-end and back-office systems or between back-office systems and external systems. You will collaborate with internal, external stakeholders and technology vendors on solution alternatives, ensuring technical compatibility, business operation suitability and pleasant user experience.

Prepare deliverables work plan, documents and report work progress to the project manager. Resolve design and/or technical issues raised by internal and external stakeholders.

job_description:
About Us
At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world's largest networks that powers approximately 25 million Internet properties, for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine's Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World's Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.
We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!
About the department
We are looking for a sourcing specialist to manage the contracts and spend with our infrastructure services and software suppliers. You will be part of the Hardware Sourcing Partnership team who is responsible for developing business and technology roadmap with the support from our global supplier network to meet Cloudflare's infrastructure goals. Technologies will be centered on Cloud computing, data center services, OEM and ODM hardware. You will be the guru towards how technology products and services are operated by suppliers and contracted through different agreements.
What you'll do
Support the end-to-end Source to Pay process across data center services, Cloud computing and hardware categories of purchases
Own contract renewal strategy of existing suppliers, and execute accordingly before deadline
Validate supplier invoices, resolve any disputes, and ensure payments are on time
Perform the development of pricing models and detailed market analysis to support tender processes and negotiations with suppliers
Build strong relationships with stakeholders to understand business needs and drive positive commercial outcomes for the company
Lead the preparation of materials to assist with future budgeting and cost management of infrastructure suppliers
Coordinate contracting process of the outgoing and inbound agreements in Hardware Sourcing team from end to end
Measure, manage and improve supplier performance against agreed service level agreements (SLA).
Examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experience
Experience with contract lifecycle management and procure-to-pay processes
Experience working with Technology service, software, OEM and ODM suppliers
Understand contracts and demonstrate a strong commercial acumen
Have financial modeling experience and know how to conduct cost evaluation
Familiar with different sourcing tools, such as RF-x
With a can-do attitude, able to execute on ideas both independently and through collaboration with others
Intellectual curiosity, particularly around technology
Excellent communication skills; ability to communicate to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Highly organized and able to juggle many tasks without losing sight of the highest priority items
Perform well in a global team environment
Preferred qualifications
3+ years of Sourcing and Supplier relationship management experience
What Makes Cloudflare Special
We're not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We're a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.
Project Galileo: We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare's enterprise customers--at no cost.
Athenian Project: We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.
Path Forward Partnership: Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.
1.1.1.1: We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here's the deal - we don't store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy commitment and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.
Sound like something you'd like to be a part of We'd love to hear from you!
This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.
Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.
Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. About NUS IT
NUS Information Technology is the cornerstone to providing reliable, high-performance and secure IT solutions and effective IT governance for the campus. Here at NUS IT, we aim to transform NUS into a borderless computing community providing knowledge at its fingertips by enhancing the use of effective applications and services for teaching and learning.
We drive a culture that is forward-looking. With a strong passion for IT, our people are always striving to improve, push boundaries and innovate with a can-do attitude. We embrace collaboration, open communication and knowledge sharing. As part of our team, you can look forward an empowered work environment that allows you to take charge of your own career path. We provide competitive remuneration as well as flexible work arrangements to enable your growth and development. We pride ourselves on our diverse workforce and are committed to transforming NUS into a leading global University shaping the future.

DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Amazon's Legal Department is looking for a talented Contracts Manager based in Singapore to support Amazon Web Services, a dynamic and rapidly growing business within Amazon.com. Amazon Web Services is at the forefront of the cloud computing and service industry providing IT infrastructure services such as on-demand compute capacity, storage, content delivery, database services, browsers and more. This Contract Manager will primarily support Amazon Web Services Asia-Pacific sales and marketing initiatives. The successful candidate will be responsible for reviewing, drafting and negotiating IT agreements (including nondisclosure agreements, reseller contracts, services agreements, marketing contracts and other commercial contracts) as well as reviewing and providing guidance on RFI/RFPs, and local and regional marketing activities. Must have excellent written and oral communication skills as this position involves direct contact with principal business owners. The successful candidate must be inquisitive, enthusiastic about technology, enjoy working hard and being continually challenged, and demonstrate sound judgment even in ambiguous situations.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. 5+ years of contracts management, paralegal, or other comparable experience within a law firm or legal department
. Bachelor's Degree
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. In-house legal experience or law degree
. Experience reviewing, drafting and negotiating the legal terms of a broad range of standard commercial contracts
. Ability to work independently while being able to contribute successfully to cross-functional teams
. Excellent organizational skills, ability to manage multiple projects at once, follow through and meet deadlines
. Strong analytical and computer skills
. Experience working in a customer focused sales and marketing environment is also valuable

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Work Here. Transform Everywhere.
VMware software powers the world's complex digital infrastructure. You may be thinking that VMware is a company that is all about virtualization while we are still the market leaders in this platform with over 90% of corporate workload, VMware provides software that build, run, manage, connect and protect any app on any cloud and any device.

Insights to your role- Solution Engineer
Are you interested in shaping the future of our customer's technology strategy, architecture, and roadmap Do you want to be make a difference
In short, SE is the person who has the responsibility of working with our clients/customers, to understand their business imperative and technical requirements, and then to build out innovative and differentiated solutions and architecture that will help these organizations drive business outcomes.

Your Experience. Required Skills

VMware Solution Engineer (SE) is a technical role who works closely with the sales team, commercial territory manager and partner business manager to identify, develop, accelerate and win opportunities.

Demonstrate deep understanding of VMware solutions and their appropriate industries in order to drive synergy and maintain credibility with prospective clients.

Perform and support tasks such as technical sales calls, presentations, proof-of-concepts, capacity planning and technical ROI models.

Ability to effectively present to customers via remote conferencing technologies such as Zoom / MS Teams and more.

To be successful what other skills would you have
In addition to the above there are some skills and abilities that would really help you be successful. These are:

Passion - Passionate about technology and how it is changing the worldfor the better,be it cyber-security,Kubernetes container technology, cloud computing, application development platform and end-user computing.

Creative Problem Solver - Creativity is an important part to the success of the role, you must enjoy difficult challenges and know how to think out-of-the-box to formulate the best outcome for the customer.

Project Success - Provide limited post-sale support to key customers primarily to the project/implementation team to ensure customer satisfaction. Also support one-to-many sales and marketing events on-site and remotely.

Communication Skills - Being an excellent communicator with both business and technical people is an essential skill for the role, while working independently and participate in the sales processes.

Customer success - helping customers to succeed and solving their problems is where you need to strive in, when customers are successful, we are successful, and you will do your utmost best in your capacity to help them realize their goals in the organization.

Work Experience / Education / Certifications / Qualifications

Bachelors or Masters Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent, other background can be considered

Relevant experience / certifications in security, applications development, DevOps, cloud, storage, networking, security will be preferred

Technically sound and able to quickly grasp the architectural concepts (e.g., datacenter technologies, networking, DevOps, Kubernetes)

Demonstrates 3-4 successful initiatives/engagements leading small teams on small-mid-d deals

Proficiency in English as the main language is mandatory

As this is a regional role, secondary language for coverage would be a plus but is optional

Previous experience in working with channel partners on solution delivery would be advantageous

Interesting facts
Things like our developer platforms on Kubernetes (in fact 2 of the three founders of Kubernetes now work for VMware!), capabilities like our digital workspace which is transforming organizations employee experience for some of the biggest companies in the world, leveraging intrinsic security to secure your applications and data, or our more cutting edge cloud management and virtual networking capabilities which is bringing the cloud into everyone's private data centre.

You may also be surprised to learn that we are one of Amazon Web Services (AWS) biggest partners and are key development partners with the likes of Microsoft, Google and SAP. We work with over 4,000 other VMware Cloud partners from the very big to the boutique ones.
Sales: VMware's Sales team focuses on two primary goals: helping customers solve their biggest business problems and hitting our bookings targets to keep our company growing and strong. We begin by forging deep relationships with our customers, so we can truly understand their business challenges and opportunities. We help drive their digital transformation by bringing VMware solutions that provide the speed, agility, and efficiency needed to compete and grow in the Internet economy. We also try to make the world a better place by hosting and participating in community activities. Are you inspired by the chance to solve your customers biggest challenges You can make that kind of difference with VMware's portfolio of industry-leading solutions. Join our team, and you can grow your career and share in the success of an industry pioneer that's turning companies into truly digital enterprises.

VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what's possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

Are you passionate about leading strategic customers on their cloud adoption journey Do you have experience in building strategic partnerships with customers and partners in Southeast Asia (SEA) and have both a business and engineering background If so, this role may be the one for you.
Azure is the fastest-growing business in Microsoft's history and is the foundation of Microsoft's commercial Cloud Services. Azure differentiates itself as the only hyper-scale, enterprise-grade Cloud that has a true hybrid story. Customers and analysts recognize Azure's tremendous momentum which continues month over month. To help customers achieve their goals, Azure continues to build the largest global footprint of any Cloud provider.
As we drive to be the leading cloud platform in the world, Azure Global is hiring an exceptional Program Manager Lead to help drive our hyper-scale business forward in SEA. Azure will be the best cloud for every customer in this hyper growth market as our landscape evolves, come make that happen with us.
When strategic customers in Emerging Markets such as SEA choose Azure as their cloud of choice, they have unique needs the way they view the economics of partnerships; their risk assessment and execution plan; their high bar for security, privacy and data residency; their specialized compute and storage requirements all contribute to the need for specialization, requiring a tailored approach. This role touches all these facets and requires a seasoned Program Manager that can lead a team, and embody a CEO mindset, scoped to a growing SEA business with a select set of customers within Azure.
Responsibilities

Engage with key customers at the CxO level, driving co-innovation partnerships in critical industries
Effectively lead a team of Program Managers to positively impact the regional business while insuring the team is the bridge between SEA businesses with Engineering teams
Experience in executive communication and ability to communicate with senior internal and external stakeholders.
Ability to identify patterns that can be replicated to create scale.
Qualifications
Required qualifications:
BS or higher degree in Computer Science or related discipline, or equivalent industry experience
12+ years of experience in ICT related industry
3+ years of experience in Cloud Computing specifically in Azure will be a plus
5+ years of experience in technical Business Development or Sales working with strategic customers in Southeast Asia
5+ years of experience in people management
Preferred Qualifications:
Deep experience working with strategic customers in Southeast Asia
Demonstrates strong analytical and technical problem-solving skills
Experience in being able to collaborate with multiple stakeholders
Ability to analyze and operate at various levels of abstraction
Ability to balance what is strategically right with what is practically realistic
Ability to innovate and drive change
Passion and focus on delivering the right customer experience

job_description:
Job Description:
Get to know our Team:
The Systems & Operations Engineering team is responsible for getting things to production in the most efficient and fastest way possible. We architect solutions, tools and platforms around provisioning, configuration, CICD, monitoring, SLA, performance and uptime. Our team is passionate about the details and we work very closely with a wide range of stakeholders.
Get to know the Role:
- Design and implement the architecture of next generation of automated infrastructure following Infrastructure as a Code model.
- Identify and resolve problems relating to critical service operations and to prevent their recurrence using different methods of automation
- Be involved in change, release and incident management
- Help improve reliability, stability and tackle scalability challenges with engineering teams
- Mentor other engineers, define our technical culture, and help build a fast-growing team
The day-to-day activities:
- Devise & implement solutions which will stop problems which are yet to happen (prevention is better than cure!)
- Everything as a code - if anything was done manually - find out the reason and fix it to ensure its never ever done manually again.
- Identify and resolve problems relating to critical service operations and to prevent their recurrence using different methods of automation
- Be involved in the design and subsequent implementation of software and service infrastructure
- Mentor other engineers, define our technical culture, and help build a fast-growing team

- Possess a solid understanding of the Linux or FreeBSD/OpenBSD family of Operating Systems and their underlying components
- Possess analytical skills, mental resiliency and the ability to think systematically under stressful conditions
- Highly accountable and takes ownership. Outstanding work ethic, high-integrity, team player, and a lifelong learner

job_description:
Job Description:
Get to know our Team:
Internal Audit is an independent function within Grab that provides an objective assurance and advisory role to Grab's senior management.
We use a systematic, disciplined risk-based approach to evaluate and assess Grab's risks, processes and internal controls.
Reflecting Grab's entrepreneurial spirit, Internal Audit covers multiple businesses and technology areas.
Get to know the Role:
As a Manager of Technology Audit, you are responsible to effectively manage audits and risk advisory activities that cover the associated risks arising from use of Technology activities across Grab's businesses.
You report directly to the Head of Technology Audit & Innovation, and work in a team of technology auditors who are specialised in the audits of Technology and related activities within the Grab's businesses.
We seek a candidate who brings excellent audit and risk advisory experience to complement the Technology Audit team, in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
You effectively plan, manage and execute audits, including the design of audit work steps to evaluate the risks associated with governance, financial, operational, regulatory, and business continuity.
The day-to-day activities:
Support the Head of Technology Audit & Innovation as part of the Technology Audit team.
Work with the Technology Audit team and partner the other IA teams, focusing on all risks arising from the Technology activities across Grab's businesses.
Plan and perform risk-based assessments, understand and evaluate the business environment, related technology controls and processes.
Prepare draft/ final report and participate in the presentation of audit findings.
Develop and maintain business relations with Grab's management, and be the trusted risk advisor on control related matters.
The must haves:
Bachelor's degree in information systems, computer science/engineering, accountancy, finance or equivalent, with professional certification (e.g., CISA, CISM, CISSP).
Specialised experience in auditing applications supporting businesses processes and products
Experienced in auditing cybersecurity domains and/or cloud computing environment will be an added advantage.
10-12 years of technology audit and risk advisory (including Sarbanes-Oxley) experience.
Strong knowledge of technology regulatory requirements and expectations within South-East Asia.
Excellent command of English.
Proficiency in productivity tools (email, calendar, Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Located in Singapore, and ability to travel for work when required.
Experience and knowledge in the following:
Excellent technology auditing skills, with strong confidence for interaction with stakeholders.
Experience with the use of data analytics and visualisation tools for audit will be an added advantage.

job_description:
Who We Are
We love changing the way the world works! We are an exciting technology innovation company that provides cutting-edge and transformative urban solutions for the facilities services industry. Our robotics and software platform turns boring data into context-rich and meaningful information to help businesses digitize and automate their current processes in an increasingly digitalized world. We pride ourselves in our values of Innovation, Excellence, Integrity and most importantly our People.
We're looking for an experienced DevOps engineer to join our team. As the ideal candidate, you're a leader and a doer - someone who can function as a big picture thinker, as well as roll up your sleeves to execute. You take a creative approach to challenges and initiatives and never settle for good enough. job_description:
This role will work directly with AWS partners and financial institutions in adapting their control frameworks to successfully move their IT to the AWS cloud.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is rapidly expanding its presence in the enterprise arena with a focus on financial services. AWS offers global public cloud offerings with a diversity of compliance programs and attestations to enable AWS customer base. AWS is looking for independent, passionate, and deeply experienced professionals in the global financial services compliance and governance arena to provide thought leadership in assisting financial institutions to move regulated workloads and data into the cloud by addressing their specific security, regulatory, compliance and governance requirements. This candidate should be an experienced and innovative security/compliance/governance professional who has the ability to handle a wide range of compliance requirements and can translate those requirements into applications for cloud computing. The Compliance Specialist will work directly with AWS partners and financial institutions in adapting their control frameworks to successfully move their IT to the AWS cloud.

This key position requires specialized experience supporting financial services sector compliance efforts and will have high visibility at the most senior levels of government agencies, institutions, and AWS including frequent interaction with CISOs, CTOs, CCOs, CROs, their staffs, and AWS senior leadership. The position, as part of the AWS Worldwide Financial Services team, will act as the primary Governance/Compliance interface for Financial Services institutions. The candidate will already have, and continue to foster, key relationships, and be able to interpret the impacts of policy changes, and track and report on industry trends.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Participate in financial services regulatory compliance assessments and relevant control discussions with AWS teams. This includes synthesizing control requirements, and recommending and pursuing alternative approaches assisting customers in developing compliance roadmaps
Develop industry leading compliance related, customer-facing resources based on projected customer needs and current demand
Assist the AWS Security Assurance team in determining the strategic direction of the various AWS compliance programs based on customer interaction and demonstrative metrics
Be and remain connected with industry trends and events. Develop and maintain relationships with key leaders in governance, risk, and compliance at Financial Services institutions
Collaborate with service teams on industry specific requirements that impact components of AWS services
Assist the work of Financial Services institutions internal and external auditors or advisors as needed
Keep the AWS Worldwide Financial Services leadership team fully informed of customer engagement status, issues, and activities.

A day in the life

About the hiring group

Job responsibilities
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems Management, or other related business fields
Progressive experience in Financial Services compliance, legal, or governance
Personal, hands-on experience in developing compliance/regulatory documentation
Experience in working directly with senior corporate/government officials and/or auditors
Strong verbal and written communication skills are a must
Must have a demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations
Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

Travel may be required for this role, up to 50%.





PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Familiarity with technical assessments and audit methodologies for technical systems (network, operating systems, application security) as well as IT auditing processes
Familiarity with cloud computing services/deployment architecture
Demonstration of innovative compliance approaches in non-traditional IT environments (cloud)
Experience and proficiency in public speaking
Deep understanding of relevant regulatory guidance Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program (FedRAMP), National Institute for Science and Technology (NIST) guidelines, Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS), FCA guidance FG16/5 (Guidance for firms outsourcing to the cloud and other third party IT services), EBA Recommendations on Outsourcing to Cloud Providers, C5 requirements of the Federal Office of Information Security of Germany and other applicable standards and requirements
Experience in building successful compliance programs
Experience defining compliance roadmaps based on customer requirements, compliance documentation, and ensuring that committed assessments are delivered on schedule
Have a record of delivery of onboarding compliance financial services workloads
Intermediate or better level of knowledge of certification requirements of an Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) under the aforementioned compliance programs
Ability to think critically and be responsive to time sensitive requests

job_description:
Job summary
Would you like to help the largest Private Equity (PE) firms and their portfolio companies leverage new technologies to improve their operations Would you like to use your IT leadership experience to build relationships with technical leaders, C-level executives, and influencers at all levels across the PE segment

As a Private Equity Solutions Architect, you will work directly with Private Equity firms, their portfolio companies, and consulting partners to help them adopt new technologies and build new solutions to make the most of the Cloud. You will be at the crossroads of business and technology, engaging with organizations at all stages of cloud adoption. You will provide thought leadership in terms of looking beyond the technology and considering the value that technology creates for our customers. You will practice your creativity by linking technology to tangible solutions and business outcomes. You will educate PE firms and their portfolio companies about the art of the possible, defining and developing cloud-native reference architectures for a variety of use cases. You will have the opportunity to present publicly at AWS conferences and industry events.

The ideal candidate will possess a technical background that enables them to drive customer engagement with business, finance or IT executives at the highest levels of our PE customers. You will have experience working with complex IT environments including applications, middleware, storage, networks, information security, and operations. You will also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and long-term about the needs of businesses

The Private Equity Solutions Architecture team is a diverse group of technologists from a variety of backgrounds. Practical knowledge of the AWS platform is desired but not required, provided you have a balanced technical foundation and a desire to learn. You will develop deep expertise in AWS technologies, as well as a broad set of tools and methodologies of how applications and services are constructed using the AWS platform.

At Amazon you will be encouraged and rewarded for doing what is right for the long-term success of your customers. We value your passion to discover, invent, and build on behalf of customers. You will enjoy keeping your existing technical skills honed and developing new ones so you can make impactful contributions to architecture discussions with customers.

Amazon has always been, and always will be, committed to diversity and inclusion. We seek builders from all backgrounds to join our teams, and we encourage our employees to bring their authentic, original, and best selves to work.

Key job responsibilities
As a Private Equity Solutions Architect, you will work directly with Private Equity Firms and/or executives of their portfolio companies to design technology solutions to solve specific business challenges or accelerate business initiatives.
Scoping and understand specific use cases to design appropriate AWS-based technical solutions (including, integrations with third party solutions).
Own the technical relationship with PE firms and the C-suite of portfolio companies and operate as their trusted advisor. The best interests of the customer will shape the guidance you provide.
Serve as a key technical member of the AWS PE team to help ensure customer success in architecting, building, migrating, or optimizing applications and services on the AWS platform.
Build rapport with Executives at both PE firms and their portcos leveraging your understanding of enterprise architecture, merger and acquisitions, migration and cost optimisation of IT infrastructure and other key technologies
Establish technical credibility with PE firms and their portcos to lead discussions with CTOs, CIOs, Chief Architects, Senior Developers, etc. from both customer and partners across the PE segment.
Provide technical and architectural guidance to PE firms and their portcs and help develop cost optimisation strategies by deploying the right architecture given their budget constraints.
Evangelise and educate key stakeholders with the Private Equity ecosystem about AWS technologies.
Influence AWS's roadmap of new features and services based on customer feedback.
Create and capture best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts).
Contribute to the growth of the Solutions Architecture organisation by hiring, coaching and mentoring others.
Develop areas of depth in technical domains relevant to your interests and your customer's outcomes.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor of Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, related field OR equivalent technical work experience.
Experience working directly with customers (internal or external) in either technical pre-sales, post-sales, consulting, or customer support function.
7-10 years of experience as a technical leader architecting, building, consulting, and/or operating large scale distributed applications and infrastructure.
Willingness to travel to customer locations as needed
Passion for technology and for learning
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience working in a customer-facing role interacting with senior levels stakeholders include C-suite.
Experience collaborating effectively with internal or external stakeholder groups (Customers, System Integrators, ISVs, etc.) at multiple levels.
Experience working in (or with) Private Equity firms, Hedge Funds, or Investment Banking specifically defining technology strategy or IT implementations/integrations related to Mergers and Acquisitions.
Working knowledge of cloud native architectures and experience architecting, developing, deploying, and/or operating IT applications or infrastructure on AWS services (or other related cloud computing technologies).
Broad technical knowledge of enterprise IT including: overall enterprise architecture, application development, database systems, server and desktop virtualisation, storage, data centre operations, networking, security, integrating enterprise applications etc.
Working knowledge in a technology domain, distributed web or mobile applications, DevOps, serverless, big data, analytics, Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence, enterprise workloads (SAP, VMware, Windows etc.), high-performance databases (SQL and/or NoSQL), complex networking implementations, highly secured workloads etc.
Experience introducing cloud or new technologies to meet or exceed business requirements.
Experience presenting in one to many public forums.
AWS certification (e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate or Professional).
Continued or advanced learning (Master, MBA, PhD or equivalent) in Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics or related technical field.

job_description:
Job summary

Are you passionate about operational excellence, including cost optimisation Do you like to solve the most complex and large-scale challenges in the world today Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help customers and partners that use cloud computing services to run their solutions reliably, securely, efficiently and at lower cost
At AWS Enterprise Support we are looking for a Senior Specialist Technical Account Manager (STAM) to provide unique deep-dive technical engagements for our Enterprise customers across Asia-Pacific, Japan and China (APJC). Based in Singapore (part of the ASEAN team), you will be a member of a dynamic team bringing the latest in disruptive, cutting-edge cloud computing technologies, focussed on the difficult cost and agility challenges facing many organisations.
You will provide strategic people, process and technology guidance to proactively improve performance, reliability, security and cost-effectiveness of customers solutions using AWS best practices. This role will focus on providing customers with AWS Cloud Operations best practices for Cost Optimisation, Monitoring and Observability, People and Process, Incident Management, Disaster Recover, Continuous Improvement and other DevSecOps topics.
About the team
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.
Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn't about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it's about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.
Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.
Basic qualifications
Minimum 6+ years of technical engineering experience
Internal enterprise or external customer-facing experience as a technical lead
Preferred qualifications
Software development experience in automation, infrastructure-as-code, tools and dashboards. Experience in a high-level programing language such as Python, Golang or Java
Internal enterprise experience working with a wide range of internal stakeholders on operations implementation or migration with a company-wide impact.
Ability to understand complex cloud environments and bridge the gap between technical and business requirements
Track record of implementing cloud best practices (provisioning, deployment, monitoring using AGILE / Devops methodologies and tools) for enterprise companies or large internet scale start-ups
Understanding of cloud operations, hybrid cloud environments and cloud migration projects at scale, particularly from an operational effectiveness and reliability perspective
10+ years of technical engineering experience
Experience in operational parameters and troubleshooting for four (4) or more of the following: Compute / Storage / Networking / Databases / DevOps / Security / Applications Development in a distributed systems environment
Professional oral and written communication skills, presenting to an audience containing one or more decision maker(s)
Experience with AWS services and/or other cloud offerings
