job_title: Data Center Capacity Delivery Leader, South East Asia
job_description:
DESCRIPTION

Amazon Web Service (AWS) is a comprehensive, evolving, and growing business unit within Amazon.com which provides cloud services. Since early 2006, AWS has provided a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. AWS Infrastructure teams build scalable low-cost infrastructure for AWS cloud services in India. If you are interested in managing programs that deliver AWS cloud infrastructure in a challenging, high growth, fast paced and customer focused work environment then AWS may be the right fit for you. Do you have the business background, complex cross functional program management experience, financial expertise, legal/regulatory comprehension and technical understanding necessary to deliver end-to-end program Can you build, lead and inspire a team of talented builders to deliver stretched results Can you communicate effectively and find clarity in ambiguity and simplicity in complexity AWS has an immediate opening for a data center delivery leader in Singapore. In this role, you will lead a team of builders who work with cross functional teams to deliver usable data center capacity. Besides leading the team, you will partner with stakeholders across different functions to build mechanisms that will help your team to develop, document, manage and deliver infrastructure designs, implementation schedules and budgets. You will earn trust of your partners in your ability to solve complex issues and steer teams towards right direction to deliver results on-time and at-cost.
The ideal candidate will be an exceptionally strong communicator (both written and verbal), and possess more than 10 years of experience in management of highly technical and strategic programs experience in data center deployment programs will be a plus. A bachelor's degree in engineering and post graduate management degree are required. Candidates possessing a background in delivery leadership roles in architecture/design, mechanical/electrical engineering, software/hardware engineering, data center infrastructure/operations, and/or construction will have a distinct advantage.
Candidate must be comfortable managing remote teams, and possess ability to remove barriers to program success. Being able to create cross-functional matrix-based teams, establish trust with a variety of stakeholders across multiple time zones, manage capital budgets, eliminate non-value-add activity, design solutions, remove blockers, and find creative ways to accelerate delivery is a must.
If you meet these qualifications, exude passion, and enjoy the challenges of deploying highly technical and innovative projects at massive scale, this job is for you! Come, join, have fun and make history!

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelor's Degree in technical streams (Or, any stream with technical experience)
. Master's degree in business
. More than 10 years of delivery experience with at least 4 years in leadership
. Experience in core project management disciplines including scope, schedule, budget, quality, along with risk and critical path management.
. Must be well organized and able to work effectively under cost and time pressure.
. Must be an inspiring leader
. Exceptional analytical, quantitative, communication, and presentation skills
. Must be able to make it simple for all stakeholders
. Must have required gravitas to communicate most effectively and respectfully at the highest levels internally and externally with partner and vendor organizations
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Experience in management of complex technology infrastructure programs (e.g. data centers, telecom, energy)
. Understanding of Information Technology, Cloud Computing concepts and specifically, AWS offerings.
. Understanding of ASEAN cloud computing and data center market and service provider.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Job Description :

*Applicants to this internship opportunity will need the work authorization for Singapore

**This could be a 3 or 6 months internship role

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a dynamic and rapidly growing business within Amazon and is the global cloud computing leader. To support our rapid growth, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and motivated people. If you'd like to help us be the best cloud services provider in the industry, this is your chance to make history. AWS HR is looking for dynamic self-starters graduating from MBA and master's programs in HR or related fields in 2023 to participate in our 2022 HR leadership development program (HRLDP) summer internship.

As an intern, you will spend 12 weeks working on a challenging and high-visibility project on one of the following teams: Builder Experience Team, Talent & Development, Compensation, Employee Relations, Workforce Planning & Analytics, Inclusion, Diversity & Equity (ID&E), or one of our HR Business Partner (HRBP) teams. You will have the opportunity to learn from senior HR leaders, receive mentorship and sponsorship, and build a network of peers, HRLDP alumni, and leaders. Upon successful completion of the internship, program participants will have the opportunity to receive a full time offer for the AWS HRLDP, a three-year rotational experience designed set you on the path to HR leadership roles in AWS. Internships will be based in Singapore.

Basic Qualifications :
. 3+ years of full-time industry work experience, which occurred between graduation from your undergraduate program and prior to starting your MBA or master's program, OR 3+ years of military work experience prior to starting your MBA or master's program
. Graduating in December 2022 or Summer 2023 from an MBA or master's degree program with studies in Human Resources or related fields
. Experience in human resources or related fields and/or knowledge of human resource theory (organizational effectiveness and dynamics, leadership, management theory, etc.)
Preferred Qualifications :
. Passion for building a career in Human Resources
. Experience working in a global or matrixed organization
. Strong business and HR acumen, including strong problem solving skills and critical thinking
. Project/Program Management Skills
. Experience in coaching senior leaders and managers
. Exceptional listening skills and ability to relate to, influence, and coach employees of all levels in the organization

job_title: AWS Managed Services (AMS) Business Development Lead, ASEAN
job_description:
DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the pioneer and recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide a platform for IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 2000 companies in financial services, pharmaceuticals, and technology. Whether customers are new to AWS, or already operating at scale, AWS Managed Services (AMS) is focused on helping customers accelerate and scale their value realization through the provision of best practice cloud operations capabilities that reduce complexities and cost, and transforms their operational and financial business models.

AWS is seeking a Senior Business Development Manager (BDM) team in ASEAN. The role will be responsible for working with both in-country AWS sales & cross functional teams, to (i) define and deliver internal AMS enablement & sales collateral (ii) drive continued growth of the AMS partner network (iii) implement effective and targeted customer acquisition programs (iv) win new AMS customer and assist with the growth of existing AMS customers. Collaboration with local and regional cross functional teams such as AWS partner team, professional services, and sales will be essential to success. In addition, this role will support ongoing internal product and process improvement, manage all associated regional reporting requirements, support key customer and partner engagements, and act as the regional point of contact for internal and external escalations.

The ideal candidate will possess a business and IT background that enables them to drive an engagement and interact at the highest levels of large Enterprises and Enterprise partners. The candidate will have the technical depth and business experience to easily communicate the benefits of cloud computing and managed cloud services to IT architects, engineering teams, and C-Level executives. The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and long-term about the needs of complex global businesses and the business process changes required to adopt cloud technology at scale. The ideal candidate will be a strong sales hunter with will be familiar with complex legacy IT environments, managed enterprise IT infrastructure services, Enterprise applications, ITIL, and has done market analysis, deal negotiation and construction, and has a background that enables them to create scalable programs that apply holistic approaches to selling to Enterprises and Enterprise Partners.

Key job responsibilities
. Work with the AWS sales leads & teams to define, build and deploy targeted sales campaigns around the AMS offering
. Support existing AMS partners, and lead the recruitment and activation of new AMS partners
. Support all aspects of the customer engagement and AMS sales cycle, meeting with senior level (CxO) customer contacts to discuss their business issues and explore how AMS can address and resolve these issues.
. Serve as an evangelist for the new service within AWS, and externally
. Establish metrics to measure and track related to adoption of the service, and field seller awareness with a continual focus on improving the approach based on those measurements.
. Prepare and give business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and metrics
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Business or technology degree / qualifications
. 10+ years of sales / program / product management experience
. Demonstrated strong communications skills, as well as leadership skills
. Experience selling cloud services and platforms (IaaS / PaaS / SaaS)

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Experience in selling technical cloud services or software technology products
. Experience in selling outsourcing and or managed services
. Experience working with CXO and selling large strategic projects
. Previous experience working for a global technology company

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow.

You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship.

You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today.

If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY

At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Job Description :
Job summary
Do you have a passion for helping customers design large distributed systems Would you like to do this using the world's most advanced cloud computing technologies Do you have a knack for helping an organization to understand application architectures and integration approaches, to architect advanced cloud-based solutions, and to help launch the build-out of those systems Are you one of those rare technologists with the communications, consultative, and leadership skills to help guide major projects to success The AWS Solutions Architecture team is hiring!

In this role, you will have the opportunity to help shape and deliver on a strategy to build mind share and broad use of Amazon's utility computing web services (Amazon EC2, Amazon S3, Amazon DynamoDB & RDS databases, Amazon CloudFront CDN, etc.) within large strategic accounts. Your broad responsibilities will include: owning the technical engagement and ultimate success around specific implementation projects, working cross-organizationally to facilitate widespread use and adoption of the AWS platform, and developing a deep expertise in the AWS technologies as well as broad know-how around how applications and services are constructed using the AWS platform.

Key job responsibilities
Candidates should have experience in most of the following areas:
. Speaking and presentation skills - Presentations, white boarding, large and small group speaking.
. Technical - Web services development/deployment experience, and IT systems and network engineering experience.
. Operations and Security - Website/web services as well as traditional IT operations, management, and security and compliance experience.
. Economic and business - RFP/Acquisition support market analysis cost benefit analysis, etc.
. Experience in engaging enterprise class environment and complex architecture designs.

Basic Qualifications :
. Location is flexible to ASEAN countries - Malaysia, Singapore, Indonesia, Philippines, Thailand and Vietnam.
. The right person will be highly technical and analytical, possess 5+ years of current solutions architecture (implementation/consulting) experience with C-Levels in large companies.
. Experience architecting infrastructure solutions using both Linux/Unix and Windows with specific recommendations on server, load balancing, HA/DR, & storage architectures.
. Experience architecting or deploying Cloud/Virtualization solutions in enterprise customers.
. Experience working within the Enterprise software market or Internet industries is highly desired.
. Deep knowledge of Infrastructure Security, Security Compliance and Operations is highly desired.
. Enterprise application and database architecture a bonus.
. Strong verbal and written communications skills in English is a must, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations.
Preferred Qualifications :
. Technical degree required Computer Science or Math background highly desired.
. Working knowledge of software development practices and Internet-related technologies highly desired.

tech_stack: ['Computer Engineering', 'Cloud Computing', 'computer information systems', 'Information Technology', 'information technology audit', 'Operating Systems', 'Leadership', 'audit committee', 'Interpersonal Skills', 'It Governance', 'Computer Science', 'Strategy', 'audit management', 'It Audit', 'CRISC', 'Audits', 'Cisa', 'Audit', 'Cissp ']
job_description:
Job Purpose:
To lead the Information Technology (IT) Audit Department (ITAD) which is responsible for carrying out IT audits to support the audit of the Government Financial Statements (GFS), other Financial Statement audits, and selective audits of public sector entities.
These IT audits are to ascertain the adequacy and effectiveness of controls in Government ICT systems and processes.
Job Responsibilities:
Develop a good understanding of the Government ICT environment, key developments and growing trends relevant to client's audits (eg control requirements in the Government Instruction Manual on IT Management, use of cloud computing, greater automation of processes, block chain technology etc.) and recommend to senior management ITAD's key audit strategies and focal areas
Lead and implement the overall direction of ITAD's annual and 5-year audit strategy and plans
Demonstrates strong ability to understand complex ICT systems. Uses this knowledge to guide ITAD's IT auditors in their conduct of IT audit projects.
Lead ITAD in continuous innovation and harness the power of data and technology to deliver high quality IT audit services.
Provide overall direction to company in upskilling the IT audit competences across all auditors in the company, such as for the conduct of IT application control audits by financial auditors. Provide technical assistance to the Audit Groups
Vet and review audit reports drafted by ITAD before they are sent to Senior Management for approval, to ensure that audit observations, concerns and recommendations are clearly articulated.
Attend Audit Committee meetings of the auditee, to clarify on company's audit observations and recommendations
Assist senior management in talent management, recruitment and retention of IT audit specialists, while actively drive the use of CAATs and automated auditing tools to enhance ITAD's productivity and efficiency.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned by senior management.
Job Requirements:
Tertiary qualifications in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems studies or equivalent.
At least 15 years of relevant experience in IT systems audit, including at least 8 years of experience in leading and overseeing audit teams.
Possess strong knowledge in the principles of IT governance, risks and controls.
Possess a good understanding of Operating Systems, Databases, Networks or Enterprise Applications. A good understanding of the IT environment/key systems of Government and public entities would be an advantage
Possess CISA, CRISC and/or CISSP Certifications
Possess strong leadership, analytical, communication and interpersonal skills.
Remuneration offered will depend on the candidate's qualifications and experience.
Working Days: 5-day work week (Mon to Fri)
Working Hours: TBC
Location: Novena
Contract Period: 2 years (chance for permanent establishment)
Salary: $12,000 to $14,000/month

As part of evidence gathering to support the audit conclusions, you will also be required to interview auditees, analyse system configurations and perform system logs analysis.
Prepare/review draft audit reports to ensure that they clearly communicate audit observations, audit concerns and recommendations to address any lapses.

Supervise and coach junior team members for selected projects.

Tertiary qualifications in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems studies or equivalent

Possess good knowledge in the principles of IT governance, risks and controls
Possess a good understanding of Operating Systems, Databases, Networks or Enterprise Applications. A good understanding of the IT environment/key systems of Government and public entities would be an advantage

Singapore Citizen

Job Description :

Amazon's Legal Department is looking for a talented Contracts Manager based in Singapore to support Amazon Web Services, a dynamic and rapidly growing business within Amazon.com. Amazon Web Services is at the forefront of the cloud computing and service industry providing IT infrastructure services such as on-demand compute capacity, storage, content delivery, database services, browsers and more. job_description:
About Sourced
Founded in Sydney, Australia, Sourced Group are market leaders in providing program and project governance & delivery, modern technical consulting to businesses around the globe. Our goal is to thoroughly understand our clients business challenges and make technical recommendations to solve them. We have supplied specialist consultants as integral team leaders and members for digital transformations in leading brands in Australia, Canada and Singapore.
A rare opportunity is available for a positive, experienced, and passionate cloud delivery consultant with strong relationship management, communication, risk management and technical delivery skills. As a Sourced Solutions Enablement Consultant (Agile Delivery Consultant) you will be at the forefront of modern delivery techniques, worked on complex transformations predominantly in AWS, and have strong enterprise governance experience in delivery, security and risk management.
Leveraging your experience, you will be able to impact a number of large organisations with their adoption of established and emerging cloud technologies.
What you'll be responsible for:
Build strong relationships with client teams and develop a deep understanding of their business objectives and strategic drivers
Form strong project team relationships by leading, coaching, and motivating team members, and identifying and resolving blockers or conflicts
Lead and nurture best practice cloud delivery cultures in client teams that require guidance and assistance with turbo charging their cloud journeys
Proactively set and manage client and project team expectations and continually seek opportunities to increase satisfaction and strengthen relationships
Create and execute project work plans and revise as appropriate to meet changing needs and project demands
Track and report on project outcomes and provide transparent communication channels to clients, project teams, and other project stakeholders
Proactively identify project issues and risks, and create action plans for resolving issues and mitigating risks
Manage security and operational risks inherent in cloud & digital transformation
You'll be comfortable and experienced in working with multiple project management concepts including PMBOK, and lean/agile/scrum
Work with the client success manager and director of business development on managing client account plans and developing opportunity pipeline
Ensure commercial changes are documented and approved through robust change control process
What you will bring to the role:
PMP and/or Agile certification and or combination of 5+ years of experience managing software delivery / cloud DevOps teams in an iterative delivery environment
You will be a high EQ individual that understands the value and importance of quality client and team relationships. This role will suit anyone who is satisfied by achieving client outcomes in an environment that is collaborative but professional, and that has a tight one company atmosphere
Prior experience in professional services working with enterprise customers in fast-paced, uncertain environments. Experience in financial services, airlines, utilities or media highly advantageous
Strong business acumen and comfort with business conversations including; writing business cases, assisting with accounts management, developing statements of work and supporting commercial conversations
Strong facilitation skills with demonstrated experience leading scoping and design sessions, sprint planning, client showcases and managing geographically dispersed teams
Demonstrable exposure working with AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Understanding of cyber security, IT risk & control practices in cloud-based environments highly advantageous
Agile approach in personal work style, with ability to be flexible and adept in dealing with and resolving ambiguity
Track record of building successful relationships, internally and externally
Detail-oriented with a flair for problem-solving
Excellent verbal, presentation and written communication skills including creating usable documentation and tools

About Sourced
Sourced is a rapidly growing global consultancy with offices in multiple regions. Founded in 2010, we provide consulting services to migrate enterprise clients to hyperscale cloud providers. We specialize in organization-wide cloud transformation and DevOps enablement for a wide range of industries, including financial services, healthcare, aviation, media, and telecommunications. Amdocs, a leading provider of software and professional services to more than 350 communication and media providers in over 80 countries, has more than 40 years of industry experience and welcomes Sourced to join its team of 26,000 employees.

Experience with more than one public cloud provider such as GCP and/or Azure

Experience working with containers using Docker

job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
There is no love sincerer than the love of food. - George Bernard Shaw
Do you love food and convenience put together Then you will definitely love foodpanda!
foodpanda (small f) is the world's favourite way to order food online from the comfort of your home or office. Whether it's getting your hands on your favourite pasta, kebab or pizza, we believe that no one should have to suffer from hunger attacks ever again.
However, this doesn't happen without some really awesome people. We are looking for a Principal Engineer (Tech Lead), based in our exciting Singapore office to support our growing regional Product and Engineering team that is also based in Singapore. You will be part of an international team of highly talented and motivated people.
As Principal Engineer, you will be working closely with our central product team based in Berlin. You will be a leader at the forefront, as this role would require strong collaboration across various technology teams. You will be responsible for building a new product solving real-life problems for our restaurant partners and contact centre. We are developing a new menu management product which plugs in with our existing restaurant portal which is based on plug-in architecture. This is a new role and you will be the first person to be hired as part of the engineering team in Singapore. In this role, you will be responsible for developing the architecture of the overall technology stack best suited for the product.
Over the next 12 months you will:
You will be responsible for hiring and building up the pioneer engineering team
You will work closely with the central product team based in Berlin and collectively identify the best tech stack for the product.
You will design, develop and release MVP of the product.
You will work closely with the existing product team based out of Singapore.
You will gain fantastic exposure to scaling a tech team at a unique pace
Required Experience:
At least 12 years of Engineering experience with at least 3 years experience managing a team
Experience with the following would be highly beneficial:Building API first systems for Single Page Application clients
Collaborating with remote second parties
Working in TDD environments unit tests, functional tests, integration tests
Setting up Automation testing suite
Containerization and infrastructure management in a large engineering organizational setting
Experience with Relational and NoSQL databases
Experience with cloud computing (AWS and/or GCP)
Experience in micro-services required
AWS clouds and the relevant DevOps services and tools
Experience with designing and architecture of microservices and distributed systems
Event-Driven architecture and DDD are a plus
Experience in software shipping cycles (dev, deploy, release, CI) and open-source software dev
Well versed in agile methodology
Comfortable with a customer-focused, high paced environment
Agile, DevOps, Software Craftsmanship: Scrum/Kanban, CI / CD, code optimization for performance and maintenance, bug management in production,
Back-end: GoLang is preferred but others are relevant as well but, Java, Python, Node.js also preferred

An extra steep learning curve
Responsibility from day one in a fast growing and global company
A vibrant and international team with a diverse background
Regular company and team events

job_title: Telecom BSS/OSS Business Development Leader, ASEAN
job_description:
DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Would you like to enable transformations at some of the largest telecom operators in the world Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a dynamic and rapidly growing business within Amazon and the leader in providing secure, reliable, scalable, and innovative cloud services that help businesses across the globe scale and grow. The AWS Telecom Business Development team is looking for a seasoned Telecom industry leader with experience in advising, winning and delivering innovative network transformation solutions for Telecom service providers.

This is a senior role within the Asia-Pacific & Japan (APJ) team, to guide customers in accelerating their digital transformations by building networks that leverage a software-based architecture, and enabling business outcomes leveraging AWS telecom-supportive technologies. You will help our telecom customers accelerate this journey by engaging with the customers business and technology stakeholders to create a compelling vision AWS services in their environment helping them learn from examples of industry leaders, reference architectures and define what great looks like for their enterprise.

This role may be located in Singapore, Jakarta, Kuala Lumpur or Manila, and will strive to create alignment among customer stakeholders, address resistance to change and provide a tangible, executable vision to transition to a cloud computing model. This leader will operate effectively at multiple levels of the organization and can address concerns across C-suite executives, IT/Network/Procurement leaders and established platform teams.

Areas of expertise will include most of the following:

* In-depth understanding across Telecommunications systems, standards & processes
* Granular understanding of the economics of network operations including BSS/OSS considerations and Telco IT strategy
* Deep familiarity with OSS, Multi-Mediation, Multi-Activation, Service Orchestration, offline and online Billing, Order management and customer experience management domains.
* Firm grasp of Network Function Virtualization (NFV) and various Virtual Network Function (VNF) technologies
* Executive level network transformation proposal structuring, presentation & negotiation, including in consortiums with partners

You will represent the AWS telecom strategy and be the leading voice for AWS telecom-focused solutions. You will leverage worldwide programs, campaigns and work closely with the wider AWS business development, product management, marketing, solutions architecture, partner and professional services teams to position the AWS telecom data strategy for telecom customers and partners.

Responsibilities will include:

* Providing business transformation and digital technology adoption thought leadership to Telecom customers & partners
* Conducting C-level executive workshops engaging and leading strategic discussions with senior telecom industry leaders regarding networks transformation
* Helping Telcos identify transformational opportunities and driving adoption of AWS solutions
* Identifying and scoping high impact transformation solutions with measurable business results for our customers
* Drive lighthouse OSS and BSS transformations leveraging cloud infrastructure and operating principles
* Work with multiple sales and technical teams within AWS and global technology solution providers for OSS and BSS applications to define and execute GTM initiatives.
* Engage each technology solution provider's field sales organizations, channels and end customers to create and drive revenue opportunities for AWS. Ensure that there is a strategic business development plan for target markets, aligned with AWS strategic direction.
* Inventing and delivering new offers, collaborating with AWS professional services, service teams, partners, and Amazon product teams
* Providing telco thought leadership by participating in industry conferences and executive briefings
* Supporting client engagements within the assigned territory and influencing activities at our Geo Accounts
* Supporting our AWS Partner Network and key industry ISVs with their Telco solutions on AWS

The ideal candidate will possess a foundation of having directly led sales / pre-sales / consulting engagements and interactions at the highest levels of large telecom operators and technology partners. The candidate should have proven expertise at thought leadership, conceptualizing customer-centric solutions, convincing C-Level executives, CIOs/CTOs & line of business leaders and IT architects, and having seen through successful sales to delivery cycles.

Additionally, the ideal candidate will have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and long-term about the needs of complex global telecom businesses. The ideal candidate will also be deeply familiar with complex legacy IT environments, managed enterprise IT infrastructure services, telecom enterprise applications, and has done market analysis, deal negotiation/shaping, with an awareness of field enablement techniques.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field
* 15+ years of experience in client related interactions, including executive presentations, relationship management, deal structuring and commercials negotiation, including working with partners in a consortium framework
* Strong understanding of Telco IT and digital transformation, including the role of cloud, data strategy, AI/ML
* Demonstrated ability and track record leading Telco sales growth within a cross-functional team (direct reporting and virtual), in complex client engagements
* Track record of building rapport with senior partner and customer executives (e.g. CEO, CIO, CTO), building close relationships, and closing large revenue accounts.
* 7+ years experience with $100M+ deals in the Telco sector in sales or business development capacity
* Demonstrated experience designing winning proposals to address the re-architecture of legacy BSS/OSS platforms to be run on public cloud.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Telco industry Business and Technical expertise across IT, OSS/BSS architectures and workloads, including ERP, CRM, Billing, Charging, Order Management, Catalogue Management, Mediation, Provisioning, Activation, Inventory Management, Service Assurance, Fault & Performance Management, Data Warehousing, Decision Support System, EAI/ESB Solutions
* Masters in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or applicable field, or MBA
* Experience creating and executing organizational change management strategies as part of a larger transformation
* Program oversight experience in a Sales / Business Development capacity, including planning, prioritization, successful project completion and maintaining a focus on high standards and quality across own organization and partners
* Experience in evaluating on-premise vs cloud computing models

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today. If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

job_description:
At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we're hiring highly technical cloud computing architects to help our partners develop technical expertise and capacity, while also collaborating with our customers and partners on key engagements. Our consultants will deliver proof-of-concept projects, topical workshops, and lead implementation projects. These professional services engagements will focus on key customer solutions such as, web applications, enterprise applications, HPC, batch processing and big data, archiving and disaster recovery, education and government.

Professional Services engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, providing collective experience from across the AWS customer base and are obsessed about strong success for the Customer. Our team collaborates across the entire AWS organization to bring access to product and service teams, to get the right solution delivered and drive feature innovation based upon customer needs
The DevOps operating model is the combination of cultural philosophies, practices, and tools that helps organizations deliver end-to-end applications and infrastructure solutions safely and at high velocity. The Senior DevOps Consultant is a leader with significant automation and programming experience throughout the SDLC. The Consultant will lead our enterprise customers through large organizational and SDLC transformations. A successful DevOps practitioner has technical depth across the Full DevOps Spectrum along with leading and evangelizing transformations, and driving innovations. Our Consultants work with enterprise customers locally, regionally and potentially domestically. As such, Consultants may be required to travel to client locations to sell and deliver professional services as needed.
About the team
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn't about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it's about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.
Basic qualifications
8+ years of experience as a technical specialist.
Familiarity with administrative tasks within popular operating systems.
Hands-on experience with architecting and automated provisioning (IaC), configuration management for infrastructure and applications.
Hands-on experience with envisioning, designing, building and managing release systems, code merging and promotion, and CI/CD workflows and tools.
Strong hands-on experience with mainline programming and scripting languages such as Shell, Python, Ruby, Perl, Java, .Net, or C++.
Experience establishing, implementing, and delivering using Agile practices.
Bachelor Degree or equivalent experience.
Ability to travel to client locations to deliver professional services as needed.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with CloudFormation, Chef, Puppet, Salt, or Ansible in production environments.
Knowledge of IP networking, VPN's, DNS, load balancing and firewall.
Experience with monitoring and log aggregating frameworks like CloudWatch, Datadog, Splunk, Opentracing, AWS X-Ray, and APM tools.
Experience with development and automated testing.
Understanding of microservices and distributed application architecture.
Experience building enterprise security strategy for cloud adoption or driving the program's evolution to meet new requirements.
Experience leading the certification or accreditation of cloud workload(s) to meet industry standards such as PCI DSS, ISO 27001, HIPAA, and NIST/DoD frameworks.
Strong verbal and written communications skills and ability to lead effectively across organizations and engagements.

job_description:
VMware is the leader in virtualization and cloud infrastructure solutions that enable our more than 350,000 Enterprise and SMB customers to thrive in the Cloud Era. A pioneer in the use of virtualization and automation technologies, VMware simplifies IT complexity across the entire data center to the virtual workplace, empowering customers with solutions in the software-defined data center to hybrid cloud computing and the mobile workspace.
Our team of 20,000+ people working in 50+ locations worldwide is committed to building a community where great people want to work long term by living our values of passion, innovation, execution, teamwork, active learning and giving back. If you are ready to accelerate, innovate and lead, join us as we challenge constraints and problem solve for tomorrow today.
The VMware Global Account Program serves approximately 100 of VMware's largest customers. Our selling is focused on our customers primary business initiatives and connecting our value to our customers business value. Our Value Selling strategy is the investment of time, talent and technology from VMWare and our partners to invent (transform) our customers business for their benefit. This strategic objective is being accomplished using a highly focused and experienced account management, marketing, and engineering teams, as well as substantial executive level engagement.
At VMware, we currently have the opportunity within our global accounts presales organization for a Global Solution Consultant (GSC) Senior Manager to join our team in support of our global landed accounts. This role will be partnered with the Region Director who manages all the sales resources for the region.

job_description:
Do you want to join an exciting, fast paced and innovative team If you're excited about technology and helping Customers, Partners and external communities learn, if you like to see that lightbulb moment in others, come join us and put your skills to great use!
Skilling has never been more important than it is right now technology is changing every second of the day and companies need skilled employees to enable them to innovate and succeed.
Come join Worldwide Learning's Microsoft Technical Trainer team we help our customers realize their potential through their employees. Help guide our approach and be ready to join a group where all ideas are heard and providing technology education is job one.
In this role, you will spend your time educating employees from companies all over the world on our cloud services. We'll help you become a best-in-class technical trainer; you'll help us drive the right skills that enable our customers to succeed.
If you're already passionate about technology and motivating others and you relish the opportunity to help revolutionize what it means to skill and be skilled, then all that's left is for you to apply and help us empower every organization and individual to achieve more.
Responsibilities
In this role, you will motivate, engage and skill students on all our cloud services.
You should enjoy continually skilling yourself on the most innovative technologies relating to cloud computing.
You will provide feedback that improves and innovates our technical training content, lab exercises, presentations, and accompanying materials.
Through all the above, you will be a Microsoft Cloud Platform evangelist with customers, partners and external communities.
Qualifications
You will hold a Bachelor's degree or have equivalent work experience in computer science, engineering, or related technical fields.

You will have a basic understanding of cloud computing concepts and solutions.
If you have hands-on experience with Microsoft's Cloud Solutions, then that's a bonus.
You will be a motivating communicator, able to help students turn abstract concepts into reality.
You should enjoy meeting people from all backgrounds, and have the ability to travel to engage them (0-25%)

Experience working with customers across various levels, developers, IT professionals, managers, and executives is required and the ability to demonstrate and explain complex solutions. The successful candidate will get the opportunity to work with a wide array of AWS infrastructure architects and specialists, as well as being brought in as the Network expert to meet with customers and partners. This position is for a highly technical Subject Matter Expert that can dive deep, work with customers, and work with internal teams to design next generation Network architectures.
Our team collaborates across the entire AWS organization to bring access to product and service teams, to get the right solution delivered and drive feature innovation based upon customer needs. ProServe engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, providing collective experience from across the AWS customer base and are obsessed about strong success for the Customer.
As a leader in the Global Specialty Practice, you will provide thought leadership and mentoring to the broader ProServe teams across APJC.
Amazon aims to be the most customer-centric company on Earth. Amazon Web Services (AWS) provides a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers critical applications for hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. At AWS, customer obsession is in our DNA.
This is a customer-facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services as needed.

10+ years within specific technology domain areas (e.g. software development, cloud computing, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data & analytics)

Deep knowledge of IPv4 and IPv6 protocols and standards
Deep knowledge of layer 2 technologies, including MPLS and Ethernet
Strong track record of implementing AWS services in a variety of distributed computing environments (including experience with Transit Gateway, VPC architecture and configuration, NFW, VPNs, and EC2 load balancing)

Experience managing data center operations, including data assurance, monitoring, alerting and notifications

Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges
Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly

job_description:
Our team, Global Partner Engineering & Tech, is looking for impact-focused, entrepreneurial engineers ready to bring their ideas and make a difference. We apply our engineering skills and business savvy to solve challenges at the intersection of business and innovation in many of today's most exciting industries and products. These include Facebook Watch, Marketplace, Instagram Shopping, Oculus, Portal, Games, Workplace, AI and many more.

We are engineers, and we write scalable, high performance code across Meta's products to ship new solutions that address partners opportunities and challenges. We also design and deliver technical solutions critical to our partners success. In doing so, we help partners realize the full value of working with the Meta family of apps focusing on helping them grow their business with us while reducing the effort and investment to leverage our platforms.

As a Partner Engineer, you will get the opportunity to see the business impact of the solutions you build with our partners. You will get to learn and build on different tech stacks and languages. You will use your entrepreneurial passion and the freedom that the role provides to create your own opportunities and choose how you make an impact. In short, it's like being the engineering lead in a startup.

Partner Engineer: This role includes a combination of partner-facing time to understand their technical and business needs and then code solutions to address those needs. That coding output can be in the form of APIs, product integrations or tools to help partners and Meta achieve mutually beneficial outcomes.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Deeply understand Meta apps and products (e.g., Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, Messenger, Oculus, Portal, Workplace, video, games, payments) and their underlying implementation
Deeply understand Meta apps and products (e.g., Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, Messenger, Oculus, Portal, Workplace, video, games, payments) and their underlying implementation
Identify and surface insights using metrics on product usage to increase adoption and provide new solutions that address the needs of our partners
Identify and surface insights using metrics on product usage to increase adoption and provide new solutions that address the needs of our partners
Identify and surface insights using metrics on product usage to increase adoption and provide new solutions that address the needs of our partners
Guide workflow changes, and gain consensus from stakeholders while driving toward solutions
Respond and maintain effective communication with industry partners and internal stakeholders
Work with partners to develop a long- term strategic plan, grounded on business objectives, and manage partners during integrations with Meta's platform products and ensure value creation
Represent Meta and our products, APIs and tools in partner meetings and industry events including F8
Understand organisational structure and cross functional team dynamics and is able to get support from those teams as needed
Build and manage strong working relationships with technical counterparts. Mentor and share knowledge with peers, creating positive atmosphere amongst team
Willingness to travel approximately 20% of the time
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
5+ years of experience as a software engineer building and shipping products or equivalent experience
Experience with open source languages such as PHP, Python, Ruby, Objective-C/C++, Swift, Java, Kotlin, Rust, Go or C#
Knowledge of the Web technology stack (for example HTTP, HTML, JavaScript, CSS) on front and backend
Experience with software design and architecture
Experience communicating technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Write and ship reliable, scalable, and efficient code
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Client/partner-facing and/or experience communicating to an audience is preferred
Experience with REST APIs, developer platforms and SDKs
Experience working on multi-person code bases including open source or personal projects
Experience with open source contributions (especially as part of larger projects)
Experience contributing to developer and platform documentation
Experience working with cloud computing platforms such as AWS, GCP, Azure
Experience working in Android codebases.
Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible todaybeyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

job_description:
Job Purpose:
We are looking for a Skilled Python Developer who can design and build best-in-class data driven applications for front office teams across the global markets business. You will work closely with product owners, project managers, developers, data scientists and other team members to deliver solutions through new and existing channels. You will need to be confident to work with senior business stakeholders to understand their requirements and to ideate and drive the development of innovative technology solutions in a timely manner.
Job Background/context:
We believe the future is here with us! Home to where we define, ideate, develop and distribute production-ready financial solutions of far-reaching impact. And right now, the door is open to help develop the future of our technology for a truly global client base. This means collaborating with the keenest minds in data science, big data, software engineering, web development, UX design and more. Doers looking to bring the next bold ideas to life for a fascinating array of clients - investing, trading and transacting at the forefront of change in markets and economies the world over.
If you have this kind of vision, are capable of seeing ahead, of developing a clear path forward in a quest to try the as yet untried, here is the opportunity. In return we offer a supported, resource-rich, vibrant co-working environment, part of an ecosystem of globally interconnected labs, realizing a broader mission of enabling growth and economic progress on a scale you won't find anywhere else. Welcome to APAC Cross Markets Analytics & Digitization (CMAD)!
Required Skills and Experience:
This role is for an Experienced Python Developer requiring a variety of strengths and capabilities, including:
Needed: Deep and broad experience in application development (Python) and technical architecture. You should proactively look to develop and implement data driven and business centric products based on best practice. You should be continually looking for process improvement.
Needed: Strong Python coding skills with some experience in data science projects. An interest in data science and machine learning.
Needed: At least four years experience working in a team environment where there is a need to deliver impactful, high quality and robust business solutions in short periods of time. You should be able to confidently work alone to find your own solutions to problems but be able to support team members on short notice when needed.
Needed: Excellent communication skills. You should be confident to work with traders and salespeople to understand their business needs and to turn those needs into data driven solutions. You should be willing to provide support for the solutions that you have developed.
Needed: A passion to work in a global markets business. You may have no finance experience, but you should have an interest in finance and a passion to be part of a high paced environment of global markets.
Great to Have: Some experiences with Big Data technologies and Cloud Computing including AWS or Google Cloud Platform. An interest in driving the CMAD cloud strategy going forward.
Great to Have: Experience of optimizing data infrastructure with hands on experience of SQL and Oracle and ideally other database technologies including MongoDB and PostgreSQL. Experience with cloud native tools.
Great to Have: Experiences with BI tools like Tableau and how to achieve data optimization for Tableau Dashboards.
Good to Have: Experience with Dev ops/ CI/ CD tools & process (some of GIT/Bitbucket, Maven, Ant, Jenkins, Sonar), Testing tools & frameworks (some of Jasmin/Karma, JUnit, Selenium, Cucumber, Mockito).
Good to Have: Agile Methodology and Tools (JIRA) Experience with MicroServices & Event Architecture is big plus Experience with Integration patterns and messaging technologies (JMS, Mule, Kafka, RabbitMQ) Experience with Caching solutions such as Hazlecast, Gemfire, EHCache. Experience with Cloud Platforms, Container/Orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes, Cloud Foundry)
Good to Have: Experience with Java eco-system and associated tooling (Core & EE, Spring Boot, Spring MVC, Spring Cloud), UI/UX (React JS, Angular or equivalent), Web Technologies (JavaScript, HTML 5, CSS, JSON, REST, SOAP).

job_description:
We are looking for an experienced DevOps Engineer to join our Technology Architecture & Policy team to participate together with operations and development in the entire development lifecycle, from design through the development process to productions support.
This incumbent will make use of the many techniques and tools typically characterized by operations and development functions, to positively impact our end-users.
We also recognize that each individual has a unique blend of skills. Whether your strength is in web application, architecture implementation or cloud computing, we want to talk to you.
Responsibilities
You will bring in new ideas, change, evolve, improve and simplify our infrastructure and services
You will develop and optimize existing features, as well as prototype and implement new projects
You have leverage knowledge in DevOps leading practices across platforms, systems and applicable use cases in influencing other teams and broader Engineering groups
You will guide and support less-experienced team members as mentor and improving the team productivity across teams
You will work with multiple engineering teams and supporting the development, build, test, release, and operations phases through innovative use of the latest technologies
You will work in an Agile environment (Scrum, XP), and be part of the continuous improvement of the Digital Operation Team
You will architect, design, and implement new sections/features/content/ improvements for existing digital channels

You will design and develop automation workflows, perform unit tests and conduct review to make sure work is rigorously designed, elegantly coded, and effectively tuned
Requirements
You will need a Bachelor's in Computer Engineering or equivalent
You will need minimum 4 years of experience in DevOps

Benefits
Competitive salaries
Flexi Benefits
Staggered working hours
Medical Insurance
Corporate Mobile Plans
Singapore Pools welcomes you not for how you look, where you come from, or differences you may have. We want you here for who you are. Diversity at the company helps us see a greater picture represented by different voices, helping us in contributing back to the society. So, feel free to express who you are, and be proud of your heritage and personal experience as you begin your journey with us!
Singapore Pools was established by the Government on 23 May 1968 to provide safe and trusted betting to counter illegal gambling. As a not-for-profit organisation, all of Singapore Pools surplus is channeled to Tote Board to fund a wide range of causes in social service, community development, sports, the arts, education and health. Currently, Singapore Pools contributes about $2 billion annually to the Government in the form of taxes and duties, and for the funding of good causes.

job_description:
VMware is the leader in virtualization and cloud infrastructure solutions that enable our more than 500,000 Enterprise and SMB customers to thrive in the Cloud Era. A pioneer in the use of virtualization and cloud technologies, VMware simplifies complexity across the entire data center to the virtual workplace, and the network, empowering customers with solutions in the software-defined data center to hybrid cloud computing and the mobile workspace. Our team of 34,000+ people working in 50+ locations worldwide is committed to building a community where great people want to work long term by living our values of passion, innovation, execution, teamwork, active learning and giving back.
Communications Service Providers are adopting virtualization and cloud technologies to transform the delivery of their services and become providers of rich 5G, Edge, and IoT offerings. As the pioneers of virtualization and cloud technologies, honed over 20 years of delivering best in class solutions to the our worldwide customer base, VMware is well placed to be a leading vendor of Telco Cloud solutions for network and IT transformation in CSP environments, and already commands a leading market share in this segment.
The VMware Global Account Program serves approximately 100 of VMware's largest customers. These premier accounts are managed by a team of experienced Global Account Executives, with the objective to establish a significant VMWare footprint in the largest and most influential corporations worldwide. Our selling is focused on our customers primary business initiatives and connecting our value to our customers business value. Our Value Selling strategy is the investment of time, talent and technology from VMware and our partners to invent (transform) our customers business for their benefit. This strategic objective is being accomplished using highly focused and experienced account management, marketing, and engineering teams, as well as substantial executive level engagement.
Role Brief:
Reporting to the APAC Telco Head, and a key part of the Global Telco Sales vertical, this Global Account Director role will be dedicated to a single telco account and will have principle responsibility for the Singtel Group worldwide. This business leader will own the overall account strategy and management including the creation and execution of a business-outcome based strategic account plan, goal obtainment, and revenue growth. This will be achieved by leading a matrix management of sales, specialist, and partner resources, to ensure value-added benefits and deeper plus wider reach into the customer. The Global Account Director will serve as the executive contact across the customer on behalf of VMware, communicating VMware's unique value. They must maintain a peer-level relationship and trusted advisor status at the C-suite level of their customer.
Role Responsibilities:
Responsible for the master strategy for the global strategic account and ensures the strategy is executed
Oversees and implements business case and value selling strategies which align the customer's needs (up to the C-Suite/Board), to VMware solutions and services
Manages tactical business while investing in larger, longer term strategic opportunities
Constructs and sells large multi-product, integrated solutions and services utilizing strategic partnerships which drive business outcomes
Maintains high touch and trusted advisor status with the customer
Delivers operational excellence in the day to day running of the account, through owning the accurate forecasting of the Singtel business globally, opportunity management and pipeline build, and representing the Singtel account on sales cadence calls
Act as an inspired leader and sales coach for a large extended team of virtual resources, to ensure consistent and effective team engagement and ensuring optimal usage of resources across management, supporting and partner organizations
Required Skills and Experience:
At least 10-15 years of experience in technology sales, including software / SaaS
Previous experience in regional sales roles across multiple geographies and time zones
At least 10 years of experience selling to Service Providers with meaningful relationships towards a range of key decision makers across the customer organization
Proven sales leadership in a global software organization with matrixed sales management responsibility, experienced in driving and closing large complex deals
Sales of Service Provider related technologies and offerings including 5G, Core, RAN, Edge, IoT, SD-WAN, SDN, SASE, Security, Orchestration, Assurance, etc.
Preferred Skills and Experience:
Our team looks for candidates who embody our EPIC2 values - Execution, Passion, Integrity, Customers and Community. Team members who are logically curious, interpersonal, customer focused and able to find the humour in situations tend to thrive at VMware.
A history of selling to Singtel in Singapore, and its affiliates internationally
Established and referencable relationships with key customer contacts
An understanding of, or experience with, VMware technologies
Familiar with Target Account Selling or another established sales methodology
Highly trusted individual who maintains and expects high standards for self and team
Self-starter with a high level of commitment and energy

Singapore
As a Barclays Technology Auditor AVP, you will report to the Director of Technology Audit in India. You will be responsible for collaborating and supporting the Technology Audit Lead in Singapore to define the appropriate coverage strategy and the audit plan for Barclays Asia Technology and Operations. You will take into consideration the Audit Risk appetite, current and future business environments, regulatory requirements and resourcing levels within the function.
Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted.
What will you be doing
Supporting the execution of audit work and delivering quality outputs within the defined timelines
Working with business audit teams to map out the key technology controls within business processes and testing them using data analytics
Supporting and at times performing continuous monitoring of relevant areas in technology, information and cyber security
Supporting the follow-up and assessment of the resolution of audit issues and providing complete, accurate and timely information for audit reporting
Contributing to evaluating the management control approach and control environment of relevant business areas
Taking on additional tasks as requested by Tech Lead/Director / Managing Director in APAC
Building and developing ongoing relationships with clients on each engagement and developing wide networks across the business
Performing Line Manager responsibilities to motivate and help develop and grow direct reports and wider team members
What we're looking for:
Bachelor's Degree or Masters in Computer Science
Familiar with one or more topic in data analytics, cyber security, business continuity and resiliency, outsourcing, cloud computing or infrastructure platforms
Good understanding of electronic trading platforms supporting the Global Markets business as well as Investment Banking platforms
Practical knowledge of technology risk and control, including application controls and/or technology processes (e.g. SDLC or ITIL)
Skills that will help you in the role:
A professional qualification relevant to technology and information risk management (e.g. CIA, CISA, CISM, CISSP)
Knowledge on new and emerging financial products and services, especially in the Markets business
Knowledge about new and emerging technologies such as cloud infrastructure, cryptocurrencies and AI / machine learning
Experience or knowledge of performing data analytics using Python (Pandas module) and SQL. Proficiency in VB scripts, PowerShell is an advantage
Where will you be working
Our office is located in Marina Bay Financial Centre, which has been carefully crafted into a city in a garden. Overlooking the scenic skyline along the Marina Bay waterfront, the green spaces and rooftop terraces have been designed to optimise employee well-being. The centre provides an integrated live-work-play development, surrounded by shops, restaurants, gyms and an alfresco dining area. Our convenient office location means you're just a 5-minute walk from the nearest MRT station.

Founded in Sydney, Australia, and headquartered in Toronto, Canada, Sourced Group is the market leader in providing cloud transformation services to the most highly regulated, security-conscious organizations globally. With operations in Australia, Canada, Singapore, Malaysia, New Zealand, and the United States, we work with the Global 200 to drive business transformation through the cloud and I.T. services. Sourced Group is an AWS Premier Partner, Microsoft Azure Gold Managed Partner, Google Premier Partner and have worked with extensive financial services and regulated enterprises such as the top banks in Canada, Australia and Singapore, as well as airlines and telecommunications companies. After recent successes, Sourced Group is continuing to expand its footprint around the world. Sourced was acquired this year by Amdocs.
Sourced Values
Here at Sourced, we are committed to providing a rewarding, enjoyable, balanced workplace and career path for our employees. We value authentic, self-driven people, who aspire to grow personally and professionally, and are committed to delivering excellence in all areas.
Our company Values are Integrity, Innovation, Service, Quality, Humility, and Sustainability.
Role
The Lead Delivery Consultant position offers an excellent career and growth opportunity for a talented and highly-motivated professional with significant prior experience in operations, management consulting and technical cloud operations. This role is part of a newly formed Solutions Enablement team in Singapore.
Sourced is a company that makes a tremendous impact and has specific knowledge and experience working in sophisticated, often complicated, and generally extensive, regulated environments. Our people are fearless and work in partnership with both client leadership and engineering teams to build world-class public cloud solutions in regulated and security-conscious verticals.
Reporting to the Head of Solutions Enablement, this newly created position is responsible for leading agile cloud transformation projects for customers in ASEAN.
As an increasing number of large enterprises move their critical systems to the cloud, we need passionate leaders to help our largest customers navigate the operational challenges of cloud platform operations. You will work one-on-one with our top-tier customers and partners, supporting not only the software development lifecycle as it applies to the cloud services but also the operations management of active services, and business relationships between the Customer, Sourced Group, and partners (such as Microsoft, AWS, and application development partners).
As a Lead Agile Delivery Consultant, you will be the primary operational point of contact for one or more customers, helping to plan, review, and oversee ongoing operations of business-critical applications. Whilst this role is business-focused, you will coordinate technical teams to deliver enterprise public cloud projects (with AWS, Azure and GCP).
You should have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges as you help our customers to build mature, stable and secure operational cloud platforms. You will leverage your broad experience in management consulting focusing on the delivery of large-scale projects across industries such as Finance, Consumer, Technology, Media and Telecommunications.
You will also be responsible for driving Cloud change program into our clients and develop the Governance and Change Management offerings.
With your team of Delivery consultants, you will be our Cloud Consultants and Site leads advocate and you will support their workload by managing timelines, scope and customers expectations. You must possess customer-facing skills that enable you to represent the Sourced team, our capabilities, and our services within a customer's environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding incidents, trade-offs, best practices, and risk management. Each day will bring new challenges to which you will need to adapt and respond. Customer centricity, tenacity, and a sense of urgency will all contribute to your success in this role. You will:
Act with a sense of urgency, be agile and pragmatic, and foster cross-team collaboration;
Support the Head of Solutions Enablement, Head of Consulting and Head of Sales assist with account management, developing statements of work and supporting commercial conversations with clients, and manage resource allocation
Supervise technical issues resolution, work directly with your team of delivery consultants, as well as escalate to subject-matter experts, and work directly with the cloud service provider(s) (GCP, AWS and Azure) to ensure customer issues are mitigated and resolved in an expeditious manner;
Facilitate discussions to ensure solutions are designed for long term successful deployment and operational stability;
As required, define I.T. and business processes and tools that work well with customers expectations to streamline the performance of the services which we provide;
Engage with Director and C-Level executives to translate business needs into technical and operational plans, as well as to provide detailed reviews of service disruptions, metrics, and detailed prelaunch planning;
Analyze and present operational reviews to customer leadership, as well as roadmap and service improvement plans;
Desired Skills and Experience
While specific responsibilities will vary based on previous experience, to be successful in the role, the ideal candidate will have the following:
8 years plus of relevant experience in I.T. operations, consulting or related industry experience in digital transformation, preferably in verticals such as Financial services, Telecommunications or the Public sector.
Familiarity with Enterprise operations including ITSM, ITIL v3+, as well as SAFe/Scaled Agile and Agile product ownership & management (Scrum, Kanban, Sprints etc)
A natural problem-solving mindset, be detail-oriented with a creative flair and a bias for action
Relevant experience in project-based, team-oriented environments and a track record of leading or working in teams and delivering against tight deadlines in fast-paced and demanding environments.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and ability to conduct and leverage sophisticated analyses to identify trends, draw conclusions and present recommendations.
Outstanding facilitation and communication skills; confidence in presenting to senior executives.
Graduate or advanced degree from a top academic program, ideally being a Bachelor's or Master degree in Business, Information Technology, or related field;
A thorough understanding of staffing, capacity planning, and performance engagement for internal teams
Agile approach in personal work style, with ability to be flexible and adept in dealing with and resolving ambiguity
Change Management principles as applied to service delivery in an international setting would be highly regarded.
Ability to lead scoping and design sessions, sprint planning, client showcases
If possible, the candidate would have large programs transformation experience, including cloud compliance, security and risk experience in regulated industries, especially the Financial and Services Industry.
Basic understanding of cloud computing. Understanding of DevOps practices would be a plus.
Why Sourced
Sourced offers huge growth opportunities in?an innovative, collaborative and inclusive?environment. We have regular team social events, personalised career development plans, supportive management and team members, training budget to utilise every year, monthly educational workshops, global relocation packages, as well as a company bonus! We provide opportunities to work on challenging technology solutions, whilst encouraging and aiding the ongoing professional development of our team.
Sourced Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a safe, diverse and inclusive environment. We encourage qualified applicants of all backgrounds including ethnicity, religion, disability status, gender identity, sexual orientation, family status, age, nationality, and education levels to apply. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know
