job_description:
We have two immediate available positions for Bioinformatics.
You will be part of an established and nationally funded multi-disciplinary and multi-institution research program that focuses on liver cancer (hepatocellular carcinoma, HCC) and other cancers. You will also play a key role in a large-scale international translational and clinical study on HCC that prospectively collect various types of patient biosamples. The program utilizes cutting-edge research technologies and employs radiomics and multi-omics approaches focused on next-generation sequencing (NGS), cfDNA NGS, single cell RNAseq and proteomics, CyTOF, 3D spatial transcriptomics, and targeted/untargeted metabolomics as well as clinical and radiological imaging datasets in the context of a clinical cohort. The candidate will also be expected to establish and work within a sandbox environment.
Your responsibilities will include the following:
- Assist the Principal Investigator in conceptualizing and designing research projects.
- Work collaboratively with scientific and clinical staff on multi-omics and radiomics data processing, statistical analyses, feature extraction for statistical/machine learning and survival analysis, and other relevant computational analyses to better understand the complexity of HCC by using various analytics tools and setting up analysis pipelines.
- Responsible for the coordination and management of the projects in the multidisciplinary study.
The job allows tremendous opportunities for professional growth and development and opportunities to publish in high-impact journals.
Requirements:
- PhD degree in Computational Biology or a quantitative background (e.g. Statistics, Physics, Engineering), or Biomedical-related disciplines with a strong evidence of computational and/or image feature extraction experience.
- Experience with large-scale bioinformatics analysis (including, but not restricted to NGS, single cell sequencing, cfDNA analysis, radiomics analysis, survival analysis and disease modelling).
- Proficient in R (tidyverse, ggplot, bioconductor) or Python (pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn) and good knowledge of Unix shell.
- Knowledge with high performance computing (HPC) and cloud computing (AWS) will be an advantage.
- Experience and knowledge in database management and data architecture will be an advantage.
- Possess excellent analytical, technical and problem-solving skills.
- Well organized and detail oriented.
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
- Able to work with diverse groups of people.
- Good team worker and fast learner.
Candidates with MSc in Computational Biology or related discipline but with significant research experience may be considered.

Support the governance and oversight of technology, information and cyber risks, and assist in technology, information and cyber risk management projects and initiatives.
Support internal / cross-functional TIC risks initiatives such as thematic and process reviews, as well as technology projects.
Monitor TIC risk exposures via dashboards and Key Risk Indicators (KRIs) and provide independent reporting on the effectiveness of TIC risk posture or activities to management.
Develop, maintain and identify opportunities to enhance TIC risk management methodologies, reporting dashboards, databases and tools.
Develop, review and maintain TIC risk framework, policies and departmental operating procedures to ensure that they are relevant, up to date and aligned to Group and regulatory standards.
As a second line of defence, provide an effective challenge on the adequacy, completeness and timeliness of risk assessments and / or action plans that have been put in place to address prevailing and emerging TlC risks. This includes the review of system risk acceptances.
Provide risk advisory services to business units on the adoption of new and emerging technologies (e.g. cloud computing, Fintech etc), as well as third party arrangements.
Plan and deliver a comprehensive TIC risk awareness training and testing program for all staff. This includes the conduct of periodic social engineering tests to reinforce awareness.
Work with Operational Risk Partners and relevant stakeholders to strengthen and promote TIC risk awareness.
Keep abreast of emerging technology risks, cyber threat landscape, industry trends relating to TIC risks.
Qualifications

WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS
At least 5 years of relevant experience in information security, technology or cyber risk in financial services environment preferred.
Good knowledge and experience with applications, infrastructure technologies and / or cyber security.
Good understanding of banking processes, technology, operations, and / or MAS regulations.
Good problem analysis and resolution skills.

EDUCATION REQUIREMENT
Academic and professional qualifications
University degree preferred.
Professional certification in information security. e.g. CISSP, CISM, CRISC, CISA etc.
Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Access, Microsoft PowerPoint, VBA and data visualisation tools

Personal attributes
Good communication, presentation and interpersonal skills to facilitate interactions with key stakeholders within and outside of the organisation.
Ability to collaborate well within the team, department and across different departments/locations.
Able to exercise sound judgment and establish plans to manage the execution of deliverables within the stipulated timelines.
Self-driven with attitude and aptitude to learn and accomplish tasks that have been assigned.
Analytical mindset and good report writing skills.
Able to prioritise and multi-task in a competitive environment
A team player.

job_description:
Our mission at Microsoft is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our partner ecosystem is at the forefront of bringing this powerful mission to life and it is the Global Partner Solutions (GPS) organization that will drive the transformation of this ecosystem to accelerate cloud adoption for customers, partners and Microsoft. The Independent Software Vendor (ISV) ecosystem is at the center of this evolution and our team that leads this area of the business embodies a culture of diversity, growth, and collaboration, making it a place where teams are challenged, learn, excel, and can do their best work.
This role is a unique opportunity to shape the direction of the world's largest strategic software partner ecosystem across Microsoft's breadth partner channels in the APAC region. As the Breadth ISV Partner Manager, you will have the opportunity to drive one of the fastest growing businesses at Microsoft that is at the leading edge of the shift to cloud services and digital transformation. This leader represents Microsoft's ISV strategy to the Partner ecosystem broadly, our ISV s directly, our field teams, and our corporate stakeholders.
The ISV Breadth Partner Manager is an influential individual contributor role within the Microsoft Customer and Partner Solutions (MCAPS) organization and across Microsoft. The charter of the Breadth ISV Partner Manager is to partner across Microsoft to develop and advance Microsoft's breadth partner strategy and drive engagement, solution development, and commercial growth across our breadth ISVs ecosystem globally. The Breadth ISV Partner Manager provides strategic leadership to build the right breadth partner strategy and engagement process to increase breadth capacity and capabilities from within the existing APAC area ecosystem and through the recruitment of new partners aligned with the strategic needs of this partner category.
The Breadth ISV Partner Manager is responsible for accelerating our partners transformation to the Microsoft Cloud and to evangelize and distinguish Microsoft cloud from other cloud providers. They must be a transformational leader who thinks ahead, leads from the front, and seeks out ways to disrupt markets with new breadth business practices, services and solutions that reimagine the way business is transacted.
Responsibilities
Breadth Partner Strategy and Execution:
Set strategy on how the ISV and MCAPS organizations will provide engagement, expertise, and resources to meet breadth ISV Partner's technology and commercialization needs and help grow their business and customer reach.
Lead and execute the breadth ISV partner engagement, business growth strategy, and overall partner performance (across technical, sales, go-to-market) for all breadth ISV partners across our Solution Areas and Strategic ISVs WW.
Provide leadership and breadth ISV voice to the programs, tools and processes required to support ISV growth through high scale, digital engines. Build business cases and secure investments with clear ROI.
Lead the breadth ISV Partner performance to Microsoft globally, in addition to the overall ISV Partners satisfaction and success.
Engage, influence, and partner with leadership across Marketplace, Global Demand Center, Engineering, Marketing, Sales, and other partner organizations across Microsoft to supplement the breadth ISV vision and strategy.
Direct Accountability for Microsoft's Breadth ISV Partner Performance
Partner closely with Marketing, Engineering, Segment, and field teams to deliver against quarterly revenue accountability.
Identify opportunities to invest and/or opportunities to implement course correction to exceed revenue targets.
Collaborate?with Field and Corporate leaders to identify planning focus areas and cases for change. Integrate change management communicated by senior level stakeholders. Remain accountable for success of sales landing?directly and by empowering others to own and drive this directly.
Execute breadth ISV strategy and plan in APAC, ensuring that ISV Breadth Partner Managers
Be?the subject matter expert for ISV related breadth co-sell engagement across Microsoft and ISV sales.?Work through the strategy, ROI and target modeling efforts for co-sell related programs.? Ensure programs?land globally and deliver to intent with regular business review rhythm and best practice sharing.
Business Leadership:
Make business and investment decisions and drive orchestration (including sales, technical, go-to-market, and channel management) to grow Microsoft business and impact across the ISV partner portfolio.
Ensure excellence in execution of go to market and co-sell strategies with partners and sales and scorecard KPI's are always met and shared accountability between their Partner Development Manager (PDM) teams and other technical, sales, marketing and service teams are clear, agreed and exceeded.
Design and lead global performance discussion building a consistent WW rhythm across the GPS ISV Teams and reporting back in to and through corporate stakeholders.
Influence leadership across Microsoft to align strategy and resources to help the team achieve targets as measured by revenue, consumption/usage, solution-build, skilling and partner satisfaction.
Qualifications
Experience in partner strategy, alliance management, enterprise sales, channels, and marketing is required. Effective business management, v-team management, and communication skills are critical. The ability to write and present complex ideas and concepts to a wide range and size of audiences, from CVP to CEO level, is a must.
Deep understanding of SMB-to-Enterprise partner business models, industry and competition, digital transformation drivers, cloud platforms, emerging computing trends and their impact on the partner eco-system.
10+ years of related experience in Global, Area level Business Management as a leader of Sales, Customer, Partner teams selling technology solutions/practice development, Cloud/Infrastructure technologies.
Proven track record of building deep business relationships with CEO's, CIO's, CTO's, CXOs
Strong executive presence including communication and presentation skills with a high degree of comfort to large and small audiences.
Extensive experience of managing virtual teams across functions and geographies
Inclusive and collaborative - driving teamwork, diversity, and cross-team alignment
Working knowledge of enterprise software management practices, including selection, deployment, and management processes.
Strong understanding of cloud computing technologies, business drivers and emerging trends as well as the impact of these on Software and Services partners and their customers.
Exceptional decision-making, conflict resolution, problem solving and negotiation skills.
BS/BA degree required.
MBA or equivalent experience a plus.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

job_description:
About Syfe
Syfe is one of the fastest-growing digital investment platforms in Singapore. We provide a holistic investment solution for retail users - from passively managed wealth portfolios that are personalized and diversified using proprietary algorithms to active trading of single stock securities. Our mission is to enable sophisticated investing at a low cost.
In July 2021, we closed a S$40 million Series B funding round led by Valar Ventures, just 9 months after raising Series A. Our existing investors followed on their original investment in a short time frame, which speaks volumes about our rapid growth and our future ahead. Moving forward, we will accelerate our expansion across geographies, launch new products and grow our team.
The Syfe team consists of industry experts from finance, e-commerce, and technology. We come from startups as well as large corporations. Excellence in execution is in our DNA. We aim to become Asia Pacific's largest Digital Investment Manager by leveraging technology to provide a superior investing experience for our customers.
Syfe was named Best Digital Advisory Solution at DigFin Group Innovation 2021 and Top Startups in to look out for in 2022 by TechCrunchFind out more about us at www.syfe.com
Press links - Bloomberg, Business Times, TechCrunch
The Right Profile

To scale up successfully we need owner-mindset PMs who can figure out areas of opportunity and can drive projects with cross-functional teams. This role will be responsible for shaping our future products and will be working closely with important stakeholders.
While it's not necessary to already have a deep understanding of finance, you should be keen to learn about investing. The idea of helping everyday people wrangle their hardest money problems should excite you.

job_description:
The Opportunity
Esco Lifesciences Group provides enabling technologies, products and services to the life sciences and healthcare industries, supporting academic research and scientific discoveries, clinical practice, as well as biopharmaceutical R&D and manufacturing. Headquartered in Singapore, Esco has an extensive sales network in over 100 countries, direct sales and service offices in over 24 countries, 8 manufacturing and R&D hubs in the US, Europe, the UK, China, Singapore, Indonesia, and over 1500 employees worldwide.
Esco is poised to benefit from the sustained growth of the healthcare and biopharma industries in Asia and globally. Esco has achieved market leadership in China, and globally, in multiple categories within some of the fastest-growing segments with China being its largest and fastest growing market. As a Singapore-headquartered company, Esco is a nexus of East and West, bridging technologies, products and talent across the world, with global operations spanning the US, Europe and Asia.
Who we're looking for
Physical/Mental Requirements/Work Environment
Ability to read, analyze and interpret scientific data and publications.
Ability to author or review protocols, technical reports and technology transfer documents.
Ability to author or review standard operating procedures and other related documents.
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw conclusions.
Ability to focus.
Repetitive motions due to certain laboratory techniques.
Ability to adapt and keep up with rapid changes in a fluid and dynamic environment as this is a rapidly evolving space.
The Scope
The position will be on a project studying the evolution of cancer genomes during early steps in carcinogenesis, with the long-term aim to develop personalized peptide therapeutics.
Responsibilities include (but are not limited to):
Apply existing analytic pipelines and devise new algorithms to explore data derived from multiple DNA sequencing technologies for both short or HiFi reads(e.g. Pacbio, Nanopore, Illumina,etc) to resolve cancer genome evolution at the clonal level.
Analyse complementary data from other technologies, ranging from single-cell RNA-Seq to chromatin immunoprecipitation to chromatin accessibility (ATAC-seq), whole exome sequencing(WES), triple-quadrupole mass spectrometry (TQMS), spatial biology using a variety of novel cellular models.
Create models to predict with machine learning to track response and thereby combat, suppress, and eliminate genome instability within the tumor microenvironment.
Create models to predict cell fate and develop molecules to help in biomass expansion and cell differentiation.
Identify and understand poor T Cell and related reactivity against computationally predicated neoantigens comparing the current state of the art and thereby developing better bioinformatic model to predict response and utilize in silico modeling to design peptide sequences for personalized peptide therapy with prediction capabilities of >90%.
Collaborate with laboratory and in vivo scientists to design, analyze and interpret experiments.
Requirements
A PhD in Computer Science, Bioinformatics or relevant field, with a strong track record of achievement exemplified by publications in development of neoantigens and required expertise in computational biology/bioinformatics.
Ability to adapt and keep up with rapid changes in a fluid and dynamic environment as this is a rapidly evolving space a strong publication record, contributions to GitHub repositories, publicly available analysis tools, or relevant patent filings.
A minimum of 5 years pharmaceutical or biotech experience in bioinformatics focused on oncology, immunology or a related field.
Knowledge of cancer biology, cancer genomics, clinical and translational science.
Firm understanding of the principles of clonal evolution / cell fate.
Experience analyzing DNA sequencing data.
Familiarity with standard methods for bioinformatic data analysis and reference datasets for gene expression, mutations, and related platforms.
Strong working knowledge of common genome analysis toolkits like GATK and BWA, as well as standard data formats common in the genomic analysis industry like FASTQ, FASTA, BCL, VCF, BAM etc. Proficient in computational workflows towards the optimal identification of immunogenic neoepitopes.
Collaborating with cross functional cGMP peptide synthesis, immunology, sequencing team.
Familiar with predictive algorithms such as NetMHCPan is highly desired.
Familiar with deconvolution of the large LC-MS/MS data sets in combination with bioinformatic analysis to predict peptide-HLA binding affinities.
Working with a cross functional team of chemists and biologists.
Experience with C#, C++, or similar software languages.
Strong Python and/or R programming skills.
Familiar with cloud computing for data processing and analysis.
Proficient with standard statistical analyses.
Strong publication record.
Excellent written and spoken English.
Demonstrated contributions to multi-disciplinary collaborations.
Preferences
Experience in choosing the right design of Peptide sequence based on Predictive algorithms and related methods.
Possess adequate experience in the development of neoantigens that reached late stage clinical trials and hence appropriate experience in a clinical set-up is highly desirable.
Proficiency with Unix-based systems and running or scripting applications from the command line.
Ability to work with any one of the popular cloud environments (AWS, GCP, Azure), containerization technologies, common workflow languages and tools, as well as data tidying and data storage best practices.
Apply now by submitting a Cover Letter and CV to [HIDDEN TEXT].
For other job openings in Esco Lifesciences Group within the respective geographies, kindly refer to corporate website.

job_description:
See yourself at Twilio
Join the team as our next Growth Account Executive, Indonesia!
Who we are & why we're hiring
Twilio powers real-time business communications and data solutions that help companies and developers worldwide build better applications and customer experiences.
Although we're headquartered in San Francisco, we're on a journey to becoming a globally antiracist company that supports diversity, equity & inclusion wherever we do business. We employ thousands of Twilions worldwide, and we're looking for more builders, creators, and visionaries to help fuel our growth momentum.
About the job
Twilio is growing rapidly and seeking a Growth Account Executive (AE) to play a key role in further growing the business. As our new Growth AE you will be responsible for prospecting, solution selling, and closing our Growth accounts (1-100 employees) including some of the most successful startups! This position reports to a Manager - Growth Sales, Rest of Asia
Responsibilities
In this role, you'll:
Be responsible for new customer acquisition and driving new revenue for a specific territory while being assigned a quota for net new ARR and maintaining the highest levels of customer satisfaction
Work with customers across all verticals to understand their business and technical requirements
Understand the capabilities of Twilio's communications API platform so that together you can craft a solution for their specific use case needs
Work diligently with cross-functional teams in Accounting, Finance, Legal, Pricing, and Operations to design mutually beneficial contracts to address customer requirements and balance the needs of our business
Have the ability to balance competing priorities and manage multiple project/deals at the same time. As an added bonus, you've previously sold cloud or B2B enterprise software.
Qualifications
Not all applicants will have skills that match a job description exactly. Twilio values diverse experiences in other industries, and we encourage everyone who meets the required qualifications to apply. While having desired qualifications make for a strong candidate, we encourage applicants with alternative experiences to also apply. If your career is just starting or hasn't followed a traditional path, don't let that stop you from considering Twilio. We are always looking for people who will bring something new to the table!
Required:
2+ years of demonstrated success in being responsible for your own book of business and directly selling a product or service in a technical SaaS/Telco space
An understanding (or interest to understand) of the cloud computing/communications business model. You are passionate about the prospect of selling to a technical audience and have a passion for a solution and value driven approach to selling.
You are able to easily lead complex contractual, technical, and financial details sound simple. You are technically savvy and experience with the cloud, APIs, communications, enterprise software, devices, and mobility is a plus.
Desired:
Experience outbound prospecting into install base, greenfield prospecting into new accounts, and executing strong QBR strategy for territory penetration within Asia.
Location
This role will be based in our Singapore office.
What We Offer
There are many benefits to working at Twilio, including, in addition to competitive pay, things like generous time-off, ample parental and wellness leave, healthcare, a retirement savings program, and much more. Offerings vary by location.
Twilio thinks big. Do you
We like to solve problems, take initiative, pitch in when needed, and are always up for trying new things. That's why we seek out colleagues who embody our values something we call Twilio Magic. Additionally, we empower employees to build positive change in their communities by supporting their volunteering and donation efforts.
So, if you're ready to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and be the best version of yourself, apply now!
If this role isn't what you're looking for, please consider other open positions.
Due to the current health crisis related to COVID-19 and the escalating visa / travel restrictions in effect, we may only be extending offers to individuals who (a) are currently physically resident in Singapore, (b) have a legal right to work in Singapore, or (c) candidates who can start in this location by the expected hire date. We're keeping the situation under review and will adjust our position should the restrictive measures be removed later on. Additionally, Twilio will require evidence of vaccination, medical ineligibility for vaccination or recovery from Covid-19 within the past 180 days, for employees going into the office as employees will not be able to access our offices from 15 January 2022 (unless such employee will complete the vaccination by 31 January 2022) without vaccination. In accordance with applicable law, we may also collect evidence of vaccination as a condition of employment for employees who require work passes as of 1 February 2022.

job_description:
The Defence Science and Technology Agency (DSTA) brings you to the forefront of cybersecurity, digital transformation and engineering. From working on software development and systems integration to unmanned technologies and artificial intelligence, you can have an impact on Singapore's defence.
Achieve your fullest potential with opportunities to build your technical expertise and hone your competencies in diverse domains. You can also expect an immersive learning experience, where you will work with bright minds and collaborate with global industry experts.

Internship opportunities and a meaningful career await you.
Learn more about DSTA at. You may also email us atgif you have any enquiries pertaining to careers.
Opportunity
We seek driven and motivated individuals tojoin our Systems Engineeringand C3 Centre where youwill have the exciting opportunity to design, develop and integrate command and control systems for the SAF and the Public Service. In this role, you will:
Conceptualise systems using design innovation/thinking techniques and incorporate technologies such as sensors/IOT, unmanned systems and information technology
Conduct evaluations, design reviews, verification and validation during system implementation and finally transiting it into operational use to bring impactful outcomes for SAF and the Public Service.
Experiment and incorporating smart technologies such as artificial intelligence and data analytics into products to enable the SAF and Public Service to carry out real-time operations, ranging from daily operations to crisis management.
Conduct feasibility studies and analysis to identify how emerging technologies can be leveraged to enhance systems and products with future-ready capabilities such as optimised resource planning, automated decision making, and tasking to response forces to respond to unfolding situations.
Establish strong partnerships with other organisations to leverage digitalisation initiatives for product trials and development.

You will be exposed to a wide spectrum of expertise with the appropriate guidance, ranging from data analytics, cloud computing and cybersecurity to develop products and deliver systems that harness these technologies for effective digitalisation and data visualisation. You will also have the invaluable opportunity to work with renowned organisations locally and worldwide to develop and deliver state-of-the-art capabilities to SAF and the Public Service.
Requirements
. Tertiary qualification in Electrical & Electronic Engineering , Computer Science/Engineering, Information Technology, Data Engineering, Communications or a related discipline
. Good written, verbal and interpersonal skills

We are on the hunt for a talented Cloud Architect to manage our company's cloud architecture and position in cloud environments. You will play a strategic role in maintaining all cloud infrastructure.
The ideal candidate will have a solid understanding of cloud computing and technology systems, as well as experience designing and transferring applications to the cloud. You should have a positive attitude and excellent communication skills to effectively share your knowledge.
The Job

When you join Trend, you become part of a unique and diverse global family and you get to work towards a world safe for exchanging digital information.
About Trend Micro:
Trend Micro, a global cybersecurity leader, helps make the world safe for exchanging digital information. As a leader in cloud and enterprise cybersecurity, Cloud One delivers a powerful range of advanced threat defence techniques optimised for environments like AWS, Microsoft, and Google, and central visibility for better, faster detection and response. With 7,000 employees across 65 countries, Trend Micro enables organisations to simplify and secure their connected world.
About the Team:
We are building a regional strategic revenue engine focusing on driving the cloud security product line, covering the Asia Pacific and the Middle East.
The regional team, including you, is tasked to develop and nurture whitespace accounts and drive them to closure independently. As part of the growth engine, we are investing in a collection of roles, including inside sales, cloud solutions architects, channel account managers, and inbound marketing specialists.
In this role, you will have full freedom to pursue whitespace accounts that present a huge potential for cloud security. You will also have the rare opportunity of working in a cross-region team and be part of an exciting enterprise we are building internally.
The opportunity will expose you to the end-to-end journey of discovering, prospecting, and closing a deal on your own the close partnership we have with AWS and Microsoft in the region and working with customers that are migrating to the cloud or are building native cloud applications.
About the Role:
As an Inside Sales Representative, your primary objective is to position Trend Micro's flagship cloud security solution - Cloud One. Cloud One protects some of the most common cloud services customers are deploying, from workload, object storage, serverless functions, containers, open sources, to getting compliance right. You will be representing a renowned company with 30 years of history in cybersecurity and a solution that has 30% of the hybrid cloud security market share.
You will be expected to develop and nurture relationships with customers in the cloud. As the primary owner of these accounts, you will be driving the entire sales cycle from start to end.
You will also need to develop the relevant cybersecurity and cloud computing knowledge in order to become a trusted advisor for your customers. You will be required to take up relevant certifications that will help you do your job better. We will help you attain these skills along the way.
You will work closely with the marketing team and the solutions architects when it comes to prospecting and closing an opportunity. Your interpersonal skills and ability to work well in teams will land you in good stead.
You will also be expected to give back to the technology community, by way of sharing your experiences and best practices. We will build you up as a leader in the cloud security space.
In your day to day you will:

Ensure health weekly sales activities: calls, leads, demos, and opportunity progression

Review sales pipeline with sales managers

Be able to advise the customers on the appropriate commercial model and channel for them

Track and update all leads and opportunities in Salesforce, ensuring proper sales operations process is followed

Collaborate closely with the inbound marketing team to drive inbound leads and convert them into sales opportunities

Collaborate with the rest of the team to improve the sales process that facilitates better sales execution, operations, tracking, and business insights

Collaborate with solutions architects to help customers solve technical challenges

You will play a pivotal role in delivering the cloud strategy for the Asia Pacific and the Middle East

You will have full control over the accounts you're assigned to and hone your sales skills

Basic Qualifications:

1-2 years of experience in sales and in the technology field

Fluent verbal and written communications skills in English

People skills and not afraid of speaking to strangers or rejections

The ability to listen to customers, understand their needs and ask clarifying/probing questions to bring the conversation forward

The ability to translate complex technology into easy-to-understand business language

The ability to handle objections and find opportunities in rejections

Persistence and proactivity in following up with customers

Strong knowledge of cloud computing and the cloud industry

Working knowledge of salesforce.com and the discipline to track all leads in the system

The ability to analyse customer conversations and produce systematic insights about tackling different types of customers/conversations

Preferred Qualifications:

A technical background in engineering or computing science is a plus

Advanced Salesforce.com experience including creating dashboards and reports

Record of success in an inside or outside sales role in a B2B environment, preferably in a solution-sales/technology-related environment

Experience working with Consulting Partners or Cloud Services Providers to build end-customer solutions

Top 10 Reasons to Work for Trend Micro

Comprehensive health insurance

Flexible working arrangements and hours as work-life balance is important for us

Paid maternity and parental leave

Give back to the community with a variety of charity programs

Growth opportunities within and outside of your existing function

Work with people who are kind, talented, and open-minded

Work on a product that's industry-leading and solves real-world problems

Work in a field puts you at the forefront of the technology world

Work for a company that has been consistently profitable for over 80 quarters

Work in a company that will invest in your skills, making you more competitive in the future

At Trend Micro, we embrace diversity, equity and inclusion. We believe that our people are our greatest asset and we understand the importance of bringing diverse perspectives, approaches and experiences to our team. We are committed to building and supporting an inclusive workforce that truly reflects our global business and encourages people from all backgrounds to apply.
We embrace change, empower people, and encourage innovation. Join Trend Micro and Thrive with us.

job_description:
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking a highly capable, self-directed Partner Marketing Manager to own the marketing strategy and programs to drive customer adoptions of Enterprise workloads to AWS's cloud computing platform through AWS Partners. If you have a passion for the cloud, experience with marketing enterprise technology applications, love helping partners reach their full potential, and are an expert in designing and implementing joint marketing plans and partner programs at scale then we're looking for you.
AWS gives customers a secure, scalable, global cloud infrastructure while paying only for what they use. Scaling through partners is a key part of how we help customers move to cloud services that power strategic workloads.
In this role, you will be a lead as a subject matter expert on how to drive Enterprise workloads to AWS through partner marketing programs. You will monitor partner marketing performance against key metrics and be an expert resource on marketing processes and guidelines for partners. You will collaborate with peers in marketing team to build mechanisms for consistency and bar-raising delivery across strategic workloads.
The ideal candidate has a passion for technology, an entrepreneurial spirit, and a successful track record in partner marketing. They have a relentless focus on the end customer and love building and running marketing enablement programs that scale and accelerate joint marketing campaigns with partners. This is a unique opportunity to play a highly visible role in an exciting technology business.
Key Responsibilities
Collaborate with regional partner leadership and field partner marketing to identify priorities, focus partner marketing initiatives, and success metrics.
Innovate and build best-in-class partner marketing programs and motions to successfully drive migration of Oracle and relevant enterprise workloads to AWS through partners.
Develop and monitor partner marketing plans with focus partners to effectively drive customer awareness and adoption of AWS services for enterprise applications.
Market at scale by designing partner marketing programs and campaign templates that can be implemented by global and regional partners.
Drive awareness and demand to AWS partner offerings through AWS-led campaigns and messaging.
Manage inclusion and promotion of partner offerings at AWS events and AWS's strategy at alliance events.
Build and promote customer case studies with partners to provide customers with tangible results and implementation stories.
Become an expert at tracking and reporting systems and process to ensure partner marketing activities are recognized, evaluated, and optimized.
Basic qualifications
7+ years of relevant work experience in partner/enterprise marketing, demand generation in cloud and/or enterprise software space
Build co-marketing for a large global partner for 3 years or account-based enterprise marketing plans
Proven record in establishing and analyzing Return of Marketing Investment metrics and conversant with lead funnel metrics and industry CRM tools
Experience in developing compelling joint content and working knowledge of digital marketing, social media and public relations
Excel in working closely with customer segment, internal cross-functional teams, external agencies and industry associations
Degree/ MBA and equivalent industry experience.
Preferred qualifications
Exceptional writing and communication skills; ability to summarize important insights for senior leadership and cross-functional stakeholders
Demonstrates strong analytical and strategic thinking skills and the ability to translate those skills into creative, marketable programs
Be a natural team player and have a desire to work with others for broader success
The fluid ability to operate successfully in a rapidly changing, ambiguous and undefined environment
Candidate will be able to understand the technology surrounding AWS products and technologies

We are looking for the following position:
Technical Project Manager

the scope of work.

motivated, perform conflict resolutions and make challenging decisions.

providers, financial institutions and large enterprises.

such as Python.

One of the fastest-growing B2B software companies in the world, OutSystems is on a mission to enable every organization to innovate through software. We are looking for talented and motivated people to join us in helping companies solve some of their most strategic business challenges, from modernizing their workplace processes to transforming their employee and customer experiences. As a member of the OutSystems global team, you will help build, deliver, manage, and evolve the software that is a low-code market leader and preferred by professional developers around the world.
OutSystems is a truly global company, with more than 525,000 developer community members, 1,700 employees, 400 partners, and thousands of active customers in over 87 countries and across 22 industries. Founded in 2001, OutSystems has offices in the United States, United Kingdom, the Netherlands, Germany, the UAE, Japan, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Australia, and Singapore, and of course has a thriving, worldwide community of remote employees.
Working at OutSystems
We do not have many rules, but we do have high standards and a culture of global collaboration. Our commitment to our culture is highlighted in The Small Book of the Few Big Rules, written by our Founder and CEO, Paulo Rosado. This commitment to culture landed us in the Forbes top cloud computing employers four years in a row.
We grow, change, and innovate, and give our teams the space to be proactive and creative.

Global colleagues who are as smart, hardworking, and driven as you.
Our DNA is disrupting the status quo. It is why our company exists.
We Ask Why a lot. It helps us connect our individual work to the bigger picture and often uncovers a better, more agile way.

In this newly created role, based either in Shanghai or Singapore, you will work with Marketing Managers to analyze data and deliver business insights on solutions to guide strategic decisions, and drive product-based campaigns. This individual will also collaborate with stakeholders from marketing, product, and sales teams to plan and execute sales campaigns for a cluster of local champions, SME customers, and Freight Forwarders, recommend and forecast targets and track progress and results of the campaigns.
Being a data planner at the Regional Marketing is about much more than simply crunching numbers it's about finding compelling insights within data and using your exceptional business and communication skills to translate those insights into action.
As one of the masterminds behind our data-driven campaign planning, forecasting and analysis, you'll spend your time digging into big, complex data sets, customer touch points and journeys. The data will not remain inert in your hands, however, since you'll use your critical thinking, problem solving and communication skills to influence and drive thoughtful and well-informed decision making with marketing and business leaders.
Our team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and customer-centric marketeers are the experience of Maersk, helping global and APA-based entrepreneurs, SMEs both individually and broadly build and grow their presence home and abroad.
Key Responsibilities
This is a hands-on position; the ideal candidate must be willing to roll-up your sleeves and work directly with large datasets, conduct data analysis, build self-service reporting tools and dashboards in an environment of rapid growth and increasing complexity, and communicate complex business insights in a clear and precise manner.
Support the full spectrum of regional marketing data analytics activities to target priority the SME segment and personas.
Deep dive into data to investigate trends, topical issues, uncover insights, and explore new opportunities for communications.
Create data reports, visualizations, and meaningful analyses to support our marketing managers in making data-driven decisions.
Partner with internal regional and global stakeholders from cross-functional and products teams, data engineers to capture business requirements, shape data, and set up processes to design and build reporting solutions.
Identify gaps and pioneer new ways to optimize campaign planning and execution, and improve data integrity.
Understand how data, and content should be used to optimize conversion rates for a digital experience
Understand and support execute SEO analysis.
Required competencies and skills
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree is required with emphasis on analytical skills e.g. E-commerce, Statistics, Computer, or equivalent practical experience
5+ years of experience in analytics or business intelligence.
Demonstrated proficiency in analytical work in marketing/sales, or a business operations and analytics environment, including analyzing data with spreadsheet software (e.g. Excel Sheets) and database query (e.g. SQL) experience
Champion of data and visualization with strong, effective presentation and story-telling skills.
Demonstrated ability to conduct sophisticated and creative analysis to solve business problems and translate the results into actionable deliverables, clearly-written summaries/presentations, and region-wide communications.
Strong verbal and written communications skills and ability to articulate complex insights to cross-functional audiences.
Great organizational skills and attention to detail; able to execute and prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously.
Team player, but ability to work independently and be a self-starter.
Social media and digital savvy.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with marketing analysis and data-backed customer segmentation is a plus.
Understanding of digital marketing, digital logistics platforms, and solutions.
Business acumen and communication skills; proficiency in translating data into actionable insights and digestible formats for the business.
Highly organized with multi-tasking skills; efficient in ambiguous situations.
Demonstrated ability to work across organizational boundaries.
Knowledge about digital campaign landscape, cloud computing market and technologies.
BA in data analytics, business or related field. Master degree is preferred.

job_description:
Mission
Xendit provides payment infrastructure across Southeast Asia, with a focus on Indonesia and the Philippines. We process payments, power marketplaces, disburse payroll and loans, provide KYC solutions, prevent fraud, and help businesses grow exponentially. We serve our customers by providing a suite of world-class APIs, eCommerce platform integrations, and easy to use applications for individual entrepreneurs, SMEs, and enterprises alike.
Our main focus is building the most advanced payment rails for Southeast Asia, with a clear goal in mind to make payments across in SEA simple, secure and easy for everyone. We serve thousands of businesses ranging from SMEs to multinational enterprises, and process millions of transactions monthly. We've been growing rapidly since our inception in 2015, onboarding hundreds of new customers every month, and backed by global top-10 VCs. We're proud to be featured on among the fastest growing companies by Y-Combinator.
What is Experiments
Our Experiments team builds growth engines for Xendit through experimental products. We do this by pushing the frontiers of what is possible in the industry and creating modern solutions to old problems.
We're looking for an experienced software engineer to innovate and iterate our way to a great solution. It will help if you have a strong interest in growth (personally and professionally) and, therefore, a continuous improvement mindset.
We also highly regard someone that is unyielding in reliable, scalable, and readable code.
You will join a small technical team and make technical decisions that will drive growth for our company. To solve for customers, you will also work closely with our business teams and work directly with our CEO.
Responsibilities
Build entire business tech solutions as experiments with best practice and scalability in mind
Build tooling to help us do that easier
Help guide business requirements with technical feasibility and constraints
Do whatever it takes to make Xendit succeed
You may be a good fit if
2+ years of a successful track record of developing quality software products and shipping production-ready software
Bachelor's or Master's degree, preferably in Computer Science, or equivalent experience
Experience in any of the following: Node.js - TypeScript, Golang
Experience with relational and NoSQL database schema design and query optimization
Strong knowledge of REST and pub/sub design patterns
Experience with unit, integration, and E2E test frameworks
Experience with Agile development
Ability to break down complex business requirements into technical requirements
Ability to architect distributed systems on cloud computing platforms
Thrive on being independent and have proven you can push towards a goal by yourself
Communicate well
You may have an advantage if
Familiar with Domain-Driven Design
Comfortable with modern DevOps: k8s, terraform
What we care about
Solve for the customer first: You build what customers want. You think about what is right for customers, not what is easiest for you
Demonstrate mastery of honey badgery: You make ambitious goals. Then executeno matter what stands in the way. When knocked down, you get up
Take on challenges willingly and can be trusted to execute: You can be trusted to get things done right the first time quickly. You hit your deadlines
You're like us: You smile a lot, think work is fun and don't take yourself too seriously. You measure yourself against the best and believe feedback is the breakfast of champions. You follow the golden rule.
You're remarkable: People naturally talk about how awesome you are. If we can't find someone who raves about you then it's unlikely we will too.

job_description:
Opportunity to work at the cutting edge of drug development
Hummingbird Bioscience is an innovative clinical-stage biotech company focused on developing precision therapies against hard-to-drug targets to improve treatment outcomes. We harness the latest advances in systems biology and data science to better understand and solve the underlying causes of disease and guide development of our therapeutics.
Enabled by our proprietary Rational Antibody Discovery platform, we discover antibodies against optimal yet elusive epitopes on important targets that have not been successfully drugged, unlocking novel mechanisms of action. We are advancing a rich pipeline of first- and best-in-class precision therapies in oncology and autoimmunity, in collaboration with global partners in academia and industry.
Our highly experienced teams in the US and Singapore span antibody discovery, pharmacology, production, and clinical development. Together we aim to accelerate the journey of new drugs from concept to clinical care. For more information, please visit www.hummingbirdbioscience.com, and follow Hummingbird on LinkedIn and Twitter (@hummingbirdbio).
About the Role
Reporting to the Head of Computational Biology and Genomics, this role will also involve close collaboration with the Chief Technology Officer for the analysis of cutting edge multi-omic and spatial data from the latest sequencing platforms. This position demands a high level of bioinformatics knowledge and genomic technologies. You will be leading workstreams to analyse unique cutting-edge multi-modal datasets to provide new insights into disease biology, develop new bioinformatics infrastructure as well as working closely with wet-lab colleagues to plan experiments and help deliver the next generation of antibody therapeutics.
Responsibilities (including, but not limited to):
Analysis of genomic, transcriptomic, multi-modal and scRNA datasets
Analysis of spatial transcriptomic data
Analysis of B and T-cell receptor datasets in the context of antigen screening assays
Mining and integration of publicly available datasets
Automation of QC processes
Identification and benchmarking of gene signatures for Precision Medicine
Creation and curation of internal data silos and databases
Development of interactive resources to support other teams (e.g. Shiny Apps)
Design and configure data flows from wet-lab instrument platforms in collaboration with the IT team
Critically analyse and interpret data and accurately document and communicate results to other teams
Core Experience and Qualifications
PhD degree or equivalent experience in related fields including physics, mathematics, engineering, biology or other related discipline with demonstrated scientific acumen
At least 3 years of professional experience in the biopharma industry/academia/CRO
Deep familiarity with machine learning algorithms in the context of biology/medicine
Deep familiarity with Unix/Linux and Docker/Singularity as well as Python, Rust, R and/or other commonly used programming languages
Familiarity with cloud computing environments such as AWS is a plus
Knowledge of pipeline management approaches such as CWL, SnakeMake, NextFlow etc
Experience of working to best practice in bioinformatics for reproducible science
Experience in drug discovery and/or drug development preferred
Demonstrated project management skills is a pre-requisite
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, along with the ability to work in cross-functional project teams
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to advance multiple projects in a fast-paced environment

tech_stack: ['Wireframes', 'Kubernetes', 'Scrum', 'User Stories', 'UI', 'Data Governance', 'JIRA', 'Data Architecture', 'Gcp', 'Data Warehousing', 'Architectural', 'Banking', 'Stakeholder Management', 'Credit Risk ']
job_description:
Job specification
The Data Product Owner Chapter Lead role is a fairly unique role encompassing both a handson product owner role for the data platform as well as a management role overseeing the other data product owners working on data products for different areas of the business.
The data organisation (chapter) is primarily partitioned into a platform team and a collection of data solutions teams.
Data platform PO component
The platform team is responsible for the setup, creation and operation of infrastructure and tooling used by data engineers, data scientists and data analysts across the organisation. As the organisation grows, we require more sophisticated and standardised tooling to manage problems associated with scale. Such problems span governance problems including data discoverability, quality, lineage, privacy as well as generally providing greater developer experience and productivity to enable us to build a more data and AI driven product. In this respect we need a data product owner to help engage with the customers of the data platform team, i.e. the data engineers, scientists and analysts using the tooling, to help shape the platform. This will involve helping build both developer tools and UI based tools, but the focus will be more on developer experience than UI.
Requirements in this respect include:
PO experience working on designing both front end and importantly complex back-end systems
Experience with scrum and associated tools commonly used with it (e.g. Jira)
Good design skills when it comes to producing architectural diagrams, wireframes, sequence diagrams and other design artefacts.
Experience working on products where data engineers, analysts, and scientists are the end users
Experience in being a developer evangelist - continuously communicate benefits of the tools and platforms, create content or materials for purpose of adoption, and conducting workshops
Basic knowledge about batch and stream data processing, data warehousing, data architecture and data governance. Knowledge about technologies such as Kafka, Spark/Flink/Dataflow, Airflow, BigQuery/Redshift/Snowflake, Kubernetes, etc.
Experience designing products to run on cloud computing platforms like GCP or AWS
Being able to monitor and anticipate technology trends
Being able to build relationships with all the key users / stakeholders of the data platform to ensure there is ongoing customer listening, both to determine new needs and assess where existing product is not meeting their needs
Being able to define, measure, and continuously evaluate the measure of success for the platform
Chapter lead component
The data solutions teams are responsible for working with the different areas of the business (internally called tribes), to help solve problems using data. Examples of tribes and associated data solutions teams include marketing, operations, credit risk, fraud & AML, finance, and a number of teams for digital platform which is the area responsible for building the core digital banking products. The teams right now consist of a mix of data engineers and data scientists, with a data product owner per team. The responsibilities of the data product chapter lead in this respect will be to help provide oversight and mentorship across the data product owners to ensure:
Standardardization of ways of working
Best practices are established
Knowledge sharing and continuous learning
Data POs have the support they need to do their jobs, particularly as it relates to stakeholder management
Helping the POs from the different teams set and measure OKRs
Defining key metrics / indicators to measure progress and success of the Products. Designing dashboards to track these.
In this respect prior experience managing product owners is required.
